So...great delivery, great customer service.LOVE the camera, mainly for the view finder. It's so incredibly hard to find a small camera with a view finder any more. Some of us with shakey hands really need it because most of my photos were coming out just a little blurry, but blurry enough that I wished I'd have the opportunity to take the photo again.Clear, crispy and colorful photos- highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Not a photography person but this camera is so easy to use, and the quality of the pictures is very impressive. I used it to take inspection pictures of my boat and short videos. The picture quality is excellent. I also bought the Case Logic TBC-302 FFP Compact Camera Case (Black) and Transcend 16GB Class 10 SDHC Flash Memory Card (TS16GSDHC10E). Am very happy with the whole set up.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot a1300 16.0 mp digital camera with 5x digital image
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I have used the camera many times and am very happy with it. Why do I need more words? Nuff said!

Reviews.Title: Was a gift
Reviews.Author: Terry Bergeron
Reviews.Content: The gift was perfect and the camera was just what was needed.  He loved the size and weight of the camera.

Reviews.Title: One of a few cameras that have lens finder
Reviews.Author: Sharon E. Slattery "Sharon Slattery"
Reviews.Content: Most cameras do not have a separate lens finder which is greatly needed if you take lots of pictures outdoors they way I do.  This one works great.  They made changes to the way you select the programs you want from the last version but it's a great camera once you get used to them.

Reviews.Title: Powershot
Reviews.Author: John Walenty
Reviews.Content: This is my second Powershot the first one worked great for the money, simple and straight forward just the way I like my electronicsWill buy another if this one dies.

Reviews.Title: Canon powershot A1300 camera 16mp digital with 5x digital image
Reviews.Author: Judith S. Margeson "jmarg"
Reviews.Content: I wish I'd gone more hi tech, but fine for what I want! Haven''t really tried everything yet., but more features than my older one.

Reviews.Title: GREAT COMPACT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: William H. Fleming
Reviews.Content: Important for me: it has a viewfinder. Quality of photos is excellent. Battery lasts a long time. Plenty of options. Only con is that it is a bit slow. Recommened to anyone.

Reviews.Title: A point and shoot with a view finder
Reviews.Author: N. Hansen
Reviews.Content: I dropped my Sony Cybershot point and shoot and was looking for a replacement. For cost reasons, I suppose, it is nearly impossible to find a point and shoot camera anymore with a view finder, except for expensive high end units.  The Canon A1300 meets the bill for me for an everyday camera that takes great travel and family pictures. We found it nearly impossible to see the screen near the pyramids at noon on a vacation trip. However, with a view finder it was no problem. I recommend it if you are looking for a reasonable priced, quality camera for vacation and family shooting.

Reviews.Title: Good to fair
Reviews.Author: P. Pitts
Reviews.Content: When I purchased this camera 3 months ago, I was looking for a fairly inexpensive one, with a viewfinder, to replace my Olympus 390 that the flash no longer worked on.  The PowerShot A1300 takes good photos, but a little slow on shutter speed for candid shots. Speed can be increased by slightly holding down the shutter button (red light shows) then push it down completely. On Automatic, it's easy to operate and the red video button clearly marked.  The video portion is fair, but audio not that great.  My biggest complaint is the miserable software. Half the time it didn't recognize the camera device in a USB port. Will say the Tech Support at Canon is wonderful. Post them taking me through a number of steps, I'm now able to by-pass the software and click on the blue button to the left of the Menu, to bring up photos. Tip: Turn off your printer before you do this  A big plus is it doesn't eat up the two AA batteries.  Been using the same ones for 3 months.  All in All it is a good little camera for the price and for someone who doesn't want to go to MIT to learn how to operate it.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: L.Jordan
Reviews.Content: I gave it to my daughter for Christmas, she loved it.  She took it out put in the new batteries and image card and started taking pictures!  Small but has all the options of the large cameras, without needing a separate bag!

Reviews.Title: God buy for the money
Reviews.Author: BPL
Reviews.Content: Powershot A1300.Nice camera for a beginner--even a child 12 or older. The quality of the pictures is good with and without the flash. It seems solidly built. No frills and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: I've bought canon before and it's a better MP than the one I had. Plus it had more functions. It works great, and I got some really amazing photos of my kids in the play they were in the "lowlight setting" and "no flash".

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jason S.
Reviews.Content: This camera is a wonderful small point and shoot camera.Pros:Takes great pictures, crisp lines and good color.Cons:The flash takes forever to recharge which can cause you to lose some great shots in a flash needed setting.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerSHot A1300
Reviews.Author: gooch49
Reviews.Content: I've had a couple of different Canon Power Shot cameras and all have taken great pictures. I bought this smaller sized one for taking on hikes as it's so compact and weighs practically nothing. Considering I'm totally blind without my magnifiers on and really can't see what I'm taking a picture of until I'm back home and dump them on my computer, most of my picutres come out absolutely great.  I'm totally amazed with this little camera and the pictures I get without being able to see my screen.

Reviews.Title: You gotta love it
Reviews.Author: Henry Getchell
Reviews.Content: The most camera for your buck. Viewfinder+AA convenience+ great features andperformance, Could you spend more and get more? Sure, but this camera isa real gem for those seeking a convenient pocket camera.at a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Casey Marie Ortega
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It takes great pictures, and you can easily adjust the settings for all types of environments (e.g. low lighting, indoors, discreet, etc.) It's very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Gift purchase
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "mj"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my granddaughter who is a new mother. It is very easy for her to use. Its small size is so convenient. The features on it are awesome, pics are great!  I highly recommend it and now I want one for myself!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price and has optical viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Old Retired Guy "Kennymac"
Reviews.Content: I think most all of the cameras today are incredible and believe it's more about ergonomics than anything else; whatever feels good in your hands is the one to buy because, frankly, with minor exceptions most everything else is equal. I do most of my photography with a Sony 77 DSLR but find that it is a bit much to carry on a "dinner with friends" or similar situation. It's just not convenient. So,I decided to purchase a "point and shoot" that would fit into my pocket, uses AA bateries, was less than $150, and has an optical viewfinder. Old habits die hard so I wanted the viewfinder. And by turning off the LCD screen and using the viefinder the batteries last forever. I have taken about 350 shots with so far, probably half with flash, and am still on the original set of batteries. Granted I installed Energizer max "8 times longer" but still..... 350 shots!The controls are easy, the pictures are great, it fits into my pocket, I am a satisfied Old Retired Guy!

Reviews.Title: Top Camera
Reviews.Author: Rickie Swim
Reviews.Content: The camera lives up to the canon name. The screen is large enough for me to see what I'm getting and it is simple to use.

Reviews.Title: Very compact camera with view finder
Reviews.Author: DAD
Reviews.Content: Pros:  View finder  Compact size  16 Mpixel  Intelligent face recognitionCons:  Slow picture taking  It takes several seconds to recharge the flash after each picture  Only 5x optical zoom (known before purchase)

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I love my little Canon it is so cute and easy to handle and store. it's zoom features make me feel like I am a real photographer. I look forward to many years of fun times. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Nothing Wrong
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Lopez "cypres0n"
Reviews.Content: I paid 69 us for this cam, i think its very easy to use, maybe the design its not the best, but is good.

Reviews.Title: Entry-level Camera
Reviews.Author: Peter C. Ladelfe
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera for my pre-teen grandchildren.  Its major advantage is that it has an eye-level view-finder which is becoming increasingly hard to find but which is essential for decent photography.

Reviews.Title: I just LOVE this little camera
Reviews.Author: B. A Kroczak "barbkro"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a point and shoot camera that used regular batteries. bought a camera from a different manufacturer and was very disappointed.  With just the LCD screen I was not able to hold the camera steady enough and I got many fuzzy photographs.  I returned it and bought this camera.  I am thrilled.  The camera warns me when I'm not holding it steadily enough and I use the viewfinder (which I'm used to from many years of using cameras with viewfinders only).  This camera has everything I need and it's smaller than I expected.  I can easily carry it in my purse or pocket. It doesn't look imposing compared to other P&S;'s (which look more flashy) but is a real winner in my book.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1300
Reviews.Author: Butch Stoddard
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, small enough for my pocket, and takes great pictures!Easy to download to my computer, and enjoy the pictures myself, and send to others.

Reviews.Title: Decent point-and-shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Akahige
Reviews.Content: This is a decent point-and-shoot camera. I bought it for my wife to use since she is intimidated by our DSLR camera and doesn't like to use it.The form factor is quite small. It is easily pocket-sized, but just large enough to be adequate for my big hands.The wide angle lens is much wider than I expected. This camera can capture a lot without forcing you to back up. On the other hand, that leaves the impact of the zoom a little weak. It has a very wide aperture for a camera this inexpensive, so it performs a little better than I expected in low light conditions. I like the independent button for recording videos, so while shooting stills, you can transition to a video very quickly and easily.The LCD screen is not very good though, so it's hard to tell if the photos are coming out very nicely. The trick is to assume that they are a little sharper and a little more underexposed than they look on the screen. When the photos looked a bit washed out on the screen, they looked great once I loaded them onto the computer. My biggest complaint is the poor LCD screen.Another thing I don't like is the absence of the Tv and Av modes (for setting aperture or shutter speed manually). There are times when I would like the control, but it doesn't bother my wife at all and shouldn't be a problem for any casual use.

Reviews.Title: Canon
Reviews.Author: szilist
Reviews.Content: It is a toy, but you get what you pay for... Very slow, so you have to keep it still if you don't want a blurry image. It is against the fact that this supposed to be a snap-shot camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for hike or the car.
Reviews.Author: Timothy T. Garfield
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price. Let's be honest you can drop upwards of $5K on a camera and you would expect that camera to have great pictures. This camera will take great pictures but make sure you don't expect the same great pictures that you can get with a camera that costs $5K.But this is a fairly cheap camera and it does what it is intended for. This camera is intended to be a point and shoot camera not a camera you take wedding pictures with. Small design and easy to pack on a hike of leave in the car for those moments you really wished you had a camera. I really liked that this camera used AA batteries, because they are cheap and easy to find. I hate having to lug a charger around with a COMPACT camera it no longer is very COMPACT. Good camera but don't expect result of a $5K camera.

Reviews.Title: It's okay.
Reviews.Author: g8er491 "g8er491"
Reviews.Content: I had a power shot A95 that I dropped one too many times and wanted to get another Canon.  I wish I had spent more money and bought a better camera.  My A95 was awesome and never took a bad picture; this camera is a lower quality and the pictures often look grainy.  I'm not an avid photographer and rarely take pictures so I thought this camera would be good enough for my needs.  I'll be splurging soon on something in the $300 range - I'm not into grainy pictures.  Other than the quality of the pictures, the functions seem easy enough to find and use.  I will be buying another Canon; I just can't recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: NOT SUPERB, BUT GREAT
Reviews.Author: TK
Reviews.Content: I do semi-pro photography, but actually prefer the small point-and-shoot cameras for many situations as I travel a good deal. Compare to several other smaller cameras I have owned and tried out, I would honestly say that this one doesn't blow my mind BUT better than most. It's drawbacks are what most small cameras have, it doesn't do as well in low light situations. When there is lack of adequate lighting, the pixelation shows. The great things are the built in effects such as fisheye, toy camera, miniature, portrait and others. I would say this camera is great for traveling. I would still say it is a better point-and-shoot camera and for the price, one can't complain.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1300 16.0 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Beverly Hahn
Reviews.Content: I thought this camera worked great.  I had never used a digital camera before and was advised by a friend to get a Canon that had the little view finder besides the picture on the back.  I was going on a once in a lifetime vacation and wanted some pictures to share.  I set it on automatic and got fabulous pictures that printed out very well besides sharing via the internet.  I would highly recommend this camera to anyone--and have!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1300
Reviews.Author: Dan Connelly
Reviews.Content: Overall I am quite pleased with this camera.  The chief reason I purchased it and not some other brand is that I absolutely need the view finder.  More manufacturer's should consider the "older generation" and their needs plus, no matter how old you are, if the sun is shining in your eyes, it's virtually impossible to see through the screen.

Reviews.Title: WOW - what a deal
Reviews.Author: RusticBK
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a "cheap travel insurance" unit but after using it (and taking the last pictures of my late brother, I can honestly say it is the best camera buy I've ever made. Pictures are clear and the movies are stunning. Worth much more than the $89 I paid.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive Canon point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: Jerry Newman
Reviews.Content: This is a great little pocket pocket point and shoot camera.  It has a rarity these days: a real viewfinder.  With the viewfinder you can see  your subject even in bright sunlight.  Don't expect to be able to make large prints or do much cropping as due to the small senor and basic lens, you loose clarity with larger pictures, but the results are usually pretty decent.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the Price
Reviews.Author: DrJean
Reviews.Content: Very reasonably priced camera. Takes clear and coloful photos. An excellent choice for the amateur.Easy to upload on to facebook.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy!
Reviews.Author: bwolcott
Reviews.Content: I am really happy with this camera for the price, its much better then the equally priced nikons and Sonys in my opinion. It also takes AA batteries so when you are in a bind it should be easy enough to get a pair of alkalines.

Reviews.Title: Counterintuitive controls and so so blurring tendency
Reviews.Author: MaconBoy "evan torch"
Reviews.Content: I am a serious DSLR photographer with several Canons.I bought this 1300 to carry for routine destinations and/ or tasks. I like it, but it has a frustrating learning curve and an annoying tendency to "remind you to death" about flash status and other less important items; changing ISO's or a small aperture adjustment is another story--a lot of wrong turns.I am a learn as you go person, but I would have memorized the manual for this camera if I had the time.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot!
Reviews.Author: DGP
Reviews.Content: I love Canon and recently got one of my cameras stolen. So, I thought I would get something that was smaller and of course affordable. I had looked up some reviews to see how this camera did, and it did get some good reviews. I am pretty happy with the size because it is small and can easily fit in a purse and larger pocket. The only thing I wasn't too happy about was that it felt cheap, like it could break easily. Maybe it's just the matt black though. But for the price, it beats most cameras and the quality is incomparable!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Pandora
Reviews.Content: i have been having more fun with this camera and getting some great pics.  i posted them somewhere on this website. the camera, contrary to some reviews is not flimsy.  it is solid and just the right weight.i gave it a four star because the learning curve is a little steep when going form mode to mode and i am having some difficulty with macro shots.  but i will get there. best thing i ever bought.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Performer
Reviews.Author: Roy B. Osborn "R Osborn"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for an absolute novice photographer on her way to St George Utah. She returned with wonderful pictures of Zion, Bryce, the North Rim, Hoover Dam, plus lots of other Nevada, Arizona, and Nevada sites. She is thrilled and that was the benchmark. Excellent performer.

Reviews.Title: EASY TO USE CANON CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Darlene
Reviews.Content: I purchased a new Canon Power Shot A1300 Digital camera for a recent trip to Italy. i had an older model of the Canon Power Shot that had served me well for several years, so when I found this newer model, with higher lens power and a slimmer design, I decided it was just the camera I needed for my trip. Having just returned from Italy, and having printed those 749 pictures (well, the card holds like 900) I can say that the pictures of the Sistine Chapel  ceiling are just as clear as if I had been on the scaffolding with Michelangelo. Whether I was shooting dark, ancient architecture, aging frescoes or lush landscapes, my Canon Power Shot 1300 captured the memorable moments of my trip. I am so very glad I bought it!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A 1300
Reviews.Author: lynn
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon Powershot A 530 and had taken about 65000 pictures with it. It was beginnig to have some problems so I got the A 1300. It took some getting used to but once I learned the different controls it has worked great. I have taken over 800 pictures so far and except for the first few when I didn't have the setting correct they have all been good.

Reviews.Title: Picture Fun
Reviews.Author: glostazz
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot is easy to use easy to understand directions I've had alot of enjoyable memories made that I will view many a time. If you want something simple to work this is the camera for you. I love using it, you will to.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: lalyc "lalyc2000"
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for over a year and I have really enjoyed it. I have 2 other point and shoot cameras - a Fujifilm and an Olympus underwater camera - but this is the one I use most frequently. It is easy to use and takes great looking photos. Most of my pictures are children, animals and landscapes. I don't do anything very fancy. I like the fact that it is small and light and easy to pack. The other thing I like is that it was not very expensive so if I lose it while I am traveling, I am not devastated.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Flo nightengale
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what a wanted - a small, lightweight camera that works for pictures of the grandkids and also excellent for those once in a lifetime pictures while traveling. Easily fits into a purse, fanny-pack  or backpack and doesn't take forever to set up.  I grab it and shoot.  The screen is large enough that this grandma can actually see what was just captured and decide if it's good enough for posterity.

Reviews.Title: excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: redbird
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little camera to carry in your purse.  I am really happy with it. I would highly recommend it to anyone. I also like the fact of having regular batteries not rechargeble ones

Reviews.Title: replaces my beloved purse camera
Reviews.Author: redreader
Reviews.Content: I love the size, easy to operate, great picture quality of this camera!  I never took the pictures I really wanted until I had a camera to keep in my purse - it's there when the pic presents itself!  I have a more professional Cannon with the long shot lens that is fantastic!  Picture quality is AMAZING!!  The problems are:  1. it's never with me - usually back at the ship or the house/hotel.  2. it's heavy, bulky, and someone has to carry it around with the accessories [which brings me back to 1].  This little Cannon fits perfectly in the little carrier I ordered at the same time for $10 along with an extra memory chip and extra batteries.  I love AA batteries because they are so available and inexpensive.My tip:  keep your camera & extra batteries available all the time.  Keep it simple for the most fun pics!  Oh, and take a look at the magenta double zip camera holder... you'll like it -- a lot!

Reviews.Title: It's great!
Reviews.Author: RAMON
Reviews.Content: I definitely like the product. It's lightweight and small making it easy to carry around. It is not a sophisticated piece of equipment making it very easy to operate. The batteries don't die extremely fast as I've seen in other digital cameras. The only thing that I would say that could be better would be the digital screen located on the back. I wish you could swivel the screen closed to preserve the screen from being scratched after use.

Reviews.Title: 4 1/2 rating
Reviews.Author: a.c.
Reviews.Content: It has good recording sound, and takes good quality photos.  I didn't give it five stars because sometimes the macro setting won't focus on the near object, but usually will on the fourth or fifth try.  I like the variety of settings that it offers.  I use rechargeable Nimh AAs on it, and they are lasting very well on this camera.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: J. Soto
Reviews.Content: I love this camera it is a little bit more advanced than my old power shot 570IS also more light.Another remarkable issue is the dedicated button for videos so you can take videos at any time.in summary a very nice canon camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good for what it's designed for.
Reviews.Author: G. Hansen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it's easy to just throw in my pocket in case I see a photo I might like to shoot.  I share them online.  I have a "big" Canon for my serious photography but it's a little inconvenient for everyday carry along.  So far, I've been impressed with the quality of the photos it produces.  I would prefer a little bigger zoom but that would require a larger camera and that's why I bought this little one.  The special settings, i.e. fisheye, vivid colors are fun.  I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for a low-cost camera but not if it's the only one you have.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Sandyconn
Reviews.Content: I was reluctant to give up my film-using camera but knew I had to make the change since no one even sells film anymore.  Being somewhat technologically challenged, a digital camera had to be really simple for me to use.  After researching several digital cameras, my son and I decided that the Canon Power Shot A1300 was the simplest for me to use.  I took it on vacation and had no problem using it.  The pictures were clear and sharp. I feel so "Tech-Savvy"!

Reviews.Title: Wish I'd never bought it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera won't take decent pictures.  Won't focus and then when it does, it takes so long that you miss the shot you were trying to get.  Wish I never spent the money on it.

Reviews.Title: It's my go- to camera
Reviews.Author: Carol J. Peltier "carol jean peltier's art an...
Reviews.Content: I love the small view finder. On really sunny days I can still see what I am shooting. One problem; the frame that I see thru the small viewer isn't what the photograph turns out to be.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: L. Burke "Busy Mom"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for our developmentally disabled adult daughter.  It is easy enough for her to use the basic "point and shoot" features.  We have not even tried the "extras" that are available on this phone.  The viewing screen is large and the camera is easy to handle.  Would recommend if you are seeking a pocket-sized, easy to use camera.  Will easily fit in a purse even in a case (sold sep).

Reviews.Title: Not as good as I hoped.
Reviews.Author: dianneskier
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a Canon with a view finder. Got one but the picture quality is not as good as my other Canon.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1300
Reviews.Author: Santa Garcia "Tita"
Reviews.Content: I am not happy with this camera. I have had other canon cameras that have been great and I find that the image you get on the screen was so much better than this one. The resolution and the picture quality is way better once you watch it on your tv or computer screen. Also this camera does not give you too many options to play with. So you are kind of stuck with what you get. On many pictures the image is distorted even with the stabilized image. Next time I will go to the store and play with the camera of my choice to make sure there are no surprises. I should had return it, but didn't hoping it was just me, and I would find a way to resolve it by learning how to adjust it or change it, but I was not that lucky. The battery life is good, but the camera body looks like a plastic toy camera.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "luvsbooks"
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera. Its small enough to throw in your purse or bag, takes excellent pictures and has a viewfinder. I will always buy a Canon.

Reviews.Title: the best camera with a view finder
Reviews.Author: shorebyrds
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for an inexpensive camera with a view finder.  This is it!!!!!  It is easy to use

Reviews.Title: Quality
Reviews.Author: Sharon Vandenberg
Reviews.Content: I need more time to determine it's quality.  So far it is good.I photograph a lot of art work and need it to be extremely accurate with good color.

Reviews.Title: No case
Reviews.Author: Raydtek
Reviews.Content: Great camera with rare view-finder that tracks with zooming.  However, don't count on the add-on case the Amazon offers.  It never arrived.  Otherwise, I'd give this order 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: exlawman2
Reviews.Author: exlawman2
Reviews.Content: I like the camera ok but it is not as simple to use as our old Canon. on the other hand, I like not having to take the memory card out of the camera in order to develop pictures..

Reviews.Title: CANON POWERSHOT A1300 CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Joy E.
Reviews.Content: An excellent and very small pocket camera for taking digital photos on the go.  It has a powerful zoom to allow for those close-in shots.  Most importantly, it has a viewfinder which is nearly impossible to get on a pocket camera and there are too many instances when you don't want to lug around a digital SLR.  Everything is fully automatic that is perfect most of the time.  Just wish it offered a little lighting control as it doesn't compensate for backlight as well as preferred.

Reviews.Title: An excellent point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: LearnMore
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a trip in dealing with a death in the family. So there was really not much time to learn how to work with it. But it worked anyway and enabled me to do what I had to do with it.This made the 'learning curve' very steep. But I was able to learn enough to 'get the job done'.I wanted a good simple digital camera that was not too expensive and this 'fit the bill'.I never got the time to really understand how to work with it. The initial pictures were not very sharp. But after things settled down a little and I had the time to 'read the instructions'. It was a whole lot better. It really did better than I expected it to do.It is a good little camera for a 'point and shoot' type of environment. When I have more time to work with it I am sure that I can do more with it. I am happy with it and would buy it again if I had to do it over..

Reviews.Title: Love my Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Robin Pilch
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a convenient size camera in silver for quite a while. The main selling feature was the view finder, which I need on bright days. My last camera was a Canon, & it was a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Not up to par...
Reviews.Author: C. Davis
Reviews.Content: This was a very cheap camera and it really didn't do the job I was expecting. If you just want a small inexpensive camera, then this may be for you. I think one other person mentioned it feels like a toy and that is probably an apt description. It might be good for a kid that prefers cameras to "phone cameras."

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Anne P. Staufer
Reviews.Content: GREAT CAMERA:  Good Buy!  This is a great little camera for traveling and  I would join the many other fans in singing its praises!

Reviews.Title: Camera with view finder
Reviews.Author: Carol M. Rosier "cramx"
Reviews.Content: Almost impossible to find a small camera with a view finder.  This one was just what we were looking for.  It was easy to use and took great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Power Shot A1300 NOT ALLMI HOPED FOR
Reviews.Author: Pinkey12
Reviews.Content: Camera not all I would expect. Photos are not crisp and the wait time between shots drives me nuts. It's okay but that's all.

Reviews.Title: Best little pocket camera I have tried
Reviews.Author: dontwannabeageek
Reviews.Content: PROS:  o  Uses readily available AA batteries  o  Easy to stick in my pocket or a small waist bag  o  Excellent color rendition  o  Decent zoom capabilities  o  Good macro capabilitiesCONS:  o  Image stabilization does NOT work with digital zoomOverall, the best little "pocket camera" I could find, based on the specs and reviews and what I wanted.  The ONLY major ding against it is that the image stabilization does NOT work once you zoom in past the 5X optical zoom... which is EXACTLY when you need it the most!!!  What was Canon thinking on that???  But otherwise, I have nothing but good things to say about the camera, especially given the price point.  So I didn't even knock off a star for the image stabilization issue.

Reviews.Title: It works
Reviews.Author: Manuel Hernandez Sr.
Reviews.Content: For the 99.00 price tag this camera is fine. It shoots its best pictures in the dim light mode, actually I've left it there permanently because of the images I get at that setting.

Reviews.Title: Great all around
Reviews.Author: Robert Bell
Reviews.Content: Compact size but uses regular batteries. Has a view finder when the screen is out in bright sun. 16 megapixels allow for easy cropping. Will handle any size flash card but maxes out at 9999, on the screen,which is way beyond what you may ever get near. Color is true and with flash even better. You must practice with it for many of the features to be understood. The button to turn on the Video is a great feature.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot camera
Reviews.Author: shirlo
Reviews.Content: This camera was not ordered by me.  It was sent back.  The camera that I ordered was a Kodak camera.  I really have nothing to say about this camera, as I have never had one.

Reviews.Title: A viewfinder!!
Reviews.Author: Anita Reach
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because it has a viewfinder.  I have been pleased with the quality of the pictures and the size is perfect.  I like to travel light and this small camera fits easily in a pocket.

Reviews.Title: It needs AA batteries
Reviews.Author: H. Haaga "real reader"
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize it needed batteries and they wear out fast. The photos are very good quality. And the camera is easy to use. I like the camera, just not the AA batteries - that's a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: Good pics, slow flash
Reviews.Author: C. Lyles
Reviews.Content: This camera takes good pics and even good low light pictures, but the flash takes some time to charge. Of course using better batteries may fix the solution. Would recommend to someone looking for an inexpensive camera.

Reviews.Title: Cheap price, and great product!
Reviews.Author: E. G. Klaproth "BMW Rider"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a year now, and absolutely love it. The battery life is acceptable, and the quality of pictures is amazing.I keep the resolution about mid-level, and the results are good up to a an 8X10 enlargement.The small size is a blessing- I keep it in the thigh pocket of my motorcycle riding suit. Videos are pretty easy to do, and look great.

Reviews.Title: Nice simple camera
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: Did not see all of the features or non features before the purchase.  It does not have a time or some of the features I was hoping for in my old camera.  It also takes a long time to recharge after a flash picture - surprising.  But if you are looking for a simple point and shoot camera - it does most things well.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: alexandra Muñoz
Reviews.Content: Totally excellent. This product is very good and incredibly beautifull. On time and with a perfect package. I totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Not good in low light
Reviews.Author: Melissa S.
Reviews.Content: I like that this camera has a view finder to use in bright light.  Maybe I need to read more of the manual but I have to turn every light on indoors to get a clear picture.

Reviews.Title: Good standard camera
Reviews.Author: PowerSource Management, Inc.
Reviews.Content: Easy to point and shoot, and video on a separate button makes it easy to jump into-- Pretty affordable for the features too.

Reviews.Title: A take everywhere camera.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera to carry everywhere in purse or pocket.  Easy to use and takes very good photos, especially in super vivid mode.  Also uses regular batteries which is convenient.  Video mode is adequate for the lens and resolution.  If you do not have a smartphone, and do not wish to carry a bigger heavy camera, this is a wonderful choice.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good but not great
Reviews.Author: dena312
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera primarily because of the viewfinder.  I have difficulty seeing camera screens in bright sunlight and I take most of my pictures out of doors.  I buy Canon cameras (this is my third digital) because I've liked the quality.  I also own a Canon SD1300IS 12.1 MP but for the reason noted, I have difficulty taking pictures with it in bright sunlight.  However, while the viewfinder on this A1300 16.0 MP camera is helpful, it only provides the view.  I still have to use the screen to see any additional information about the picture, which limits the usefulness of the viewfinder.  In addition, the picture quality does not seem to be as good as my older Canon.  This is a subjective opinion.  I haven't put similar pictures side by side.  And, to be fair to the cameras, I'm a point and shoot photographer. While I know these cameras have many wonderful optional settings, If I'm on a hike, I leave the setting on AUTO when taking pictures.  If I'm going to be taking pictures indoors or on a cloudy day, I still choose my older SD1300IS 12.1 MP camera.  It's smaller, solidly built and has excellent picture quality and battery life.  Bottom line, if you don't need the viewfinder and want a good inexpensive camera, stick with a camera like the SD1300IS.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: stephanie Felix
Reviews.Content: it just work well i love it, just wish the zoom would be much better after that i have no problem with it

Reviews.Title: Broken less than a year
Reviews.Author: Sundanceny
Reviews.Content: Less than a year of usage and camera is broken. Something wrong internally, it doesn't even power on. We don't even have a scratch on it.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: CR
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera that also has a view finder. This is a must for me. I bought the same Model two years ago and it seem more sturdy. The main defect with this camera is the battery door is very flimsly.

Reviews.Title: cannon seals the deal
Reviews.Author: Mahbubul Maruf "nycsmaruf"
Reviews.Content: this is a camera you can buy with confidence and be happy with the pictures you get, but if you want something a little better, you should get a little older ones called "elph" by cannon.this is VERY CHEAP... AND the pictures out performs even some other company's SLR's.one thing you should know, you will get similar or better quality picture with a cannon's 8 megapixel than a nikon's or fuji' or sony's 12 megapixel, so do not look at how many mp the camera is... I have used 7 cannon camera, two of them are SLR and i have a black and white old style slr, two nikon's 2 olympus and a sony until now and i can confidently tell you close your eyes and buy a cannon for very cheap, and start shooting and you will be happy with your picture quality.super easy to use point and shootzoom isn't very goodbut it gets very handy if you are forgetful when you travel and forget your charger, you can just buy aa batteries and go on... (happened to me) because those are anywhere in the world.if you are concerned about the battery just buy some rechargeable ones, and you should be fine!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera.
Reviews.Author: NJ Hiker
Reviews.Content: Love this camera - its small and takes great pictures - much better than a cell phone.  I have printed many of them out as 8 x 10's for display.

Reviews.Title: Very cheaply made
Reviews.Author: aloha guy
Reviews.Content: Viewfinder so small as to be practically useless, I sold mine on ebay and bought a Nikon L820 coolpix, much nicer camera.

Reviews.Title: This Camera is a Great Bargain, Lots of great features with a low price.
Reviews.Author: Carol Couch
Reviews.Content: It is unbelievable to get this quality of a camera for under $100.  Due to most of my photography being outdoors I needed  a viewfinder but couldn't find one for under $150.  This was fit the bill.  The photo's come out super sharp and the LCD viewer is so sharp I find most of the time I don't even have to use the viewfinder outdoors.  Because it used AA batteries I don't have to worry that I will run out of battery power before I get my work done.

Reviews.Title: Like the camera
Reviews.Author: Reba J. Barnes
Reviews.Content: I have had very good luck with this Canon camera - does a good job and a handy size to carry around.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with view finder.
Reviews.Author: Bret S. Martin "Slick"
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a gift for a relative going to Costa Rica. It was one of the few that has a view finder as well as screen. Much easier to shoot quickly and in bright sun light. They said it worked perfect and we saw the pictures of their trip. Very good!

Reviews.Title: Decent camera
Reviews.Author: M. Karazim
Reviews.Content: This is a good basic camera.  I purchased it for Christmas last year for my not-so-tech-savvy mother, and she loves it and uses it with no problems.  She takes photos, reviews them, and prints them out without frustration, which is important, since electronic devices tend to frustrate her easily.  It takes adequate quality photos for her needs and she is very satisfied with it.I have a DSLR camera and I am by no means satisfied with the picture quality of this thing, but if you don't have anything to compare it to and keep in mind that it's very basic, it's not bad.  It would make a good first camera for a young person, a good camera for an older person who isn't tech savvy, and a good "throw away" model just to have on hand that you don't necessarily care too much about damaging.  For anything more than that, I'd suggest spending a bit more money.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Tim Mizer
Reviews.Content: Use this camera for work pictures instead of my expensive Canon.  Matches the other 3 we have in the office to take pictures of buildings and construction.

Reviews.Title: simple to use.
Reviews.Author: John Cotton
Reviews.Content: Easy to use controls. Good viewfinder for bright sunlight. Uploaded picture definition not as good as I expected. Like it.

Reviews.Title: Having trouble with it.
Reviews.Author: M.E.R.
Reviews.Content: This is too complicated for me, and right now is not working properly.  Don't know where to have it fixed.

Reviews.Title: Enjoy using it.
Reviews.Author: LInda
Reviews.Content: this camera is very easy to use. The pictures come out surprisingly well. My only complaint is that I it does not take good long distance shots.

Reviews.Title: Great transaction
Reviews.Author: Mario
Reviews.Content: Canon Power Shot A1300 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 5x Digital Image is good camera. I am using this product for more than a year and works flowlessly

Reviews.Title: Great replacement camera.
Reviews.Author: RMangus
Reviews.Content: My original Canon PowerShot camera was stolen from my house during a robbery. I like the orional and wanted something similar. I took this camera to Europe this past summer while on a cruise. The pictures turned out fine. I only wished that this camera had a greater zoom.  The camera is lightweight and easy to operate. Took nice videos too.

Reviews.Title: It has a viewfinder!
Reviews.Author: Pam
Reviews.Content: Finding a camera with a viewfinder is getting to be impossible.  I was going on a trip and my old cannon had died.  The cheap camera I'd used to replace it didn't have a view finder, and taking outdoor pictures on a sunny day was impossible.  This is a great camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: wife loves it
Reviews.Author: artie2385
Reviews.Content: suddenly you realize that a camera phone is not the greatest camera(probably not a great phone either). i gave this to my wife for christmas, she (WE) are not tech savy , but through playing a little each day she figured it out  with all the features which shows how easy it is to use. one reason also to buy this is it runs on regular batteries, i buy aaa/aa batteries buy the billion pack for lights,remotes etc , so if you are going to a event throw some extra in your pocket, if you forget what 7-11 or corner bodega doesnt carry batteries. so if you want a camera to take pictures and to be ready when you are this is it.

Reviews.Title: Small package, great photos
Reviews.Author: David Pugh
Reviews.Content: Small and flat enough to go with me just about anywhere, real quality photos. Pretty much just stays on AUTO but its great to have at parties or camping, shoots fast with quick recharge time on the flash. great LCD display on the back too for photo review. Its a keeper!

Reviews.Title: 2nd try with this camera - Batteries won't hold a charge
Reviews.Author: Linda B. Cone "Chechako"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these cameras in April, 2013, and really liked it. It was easy to use, and the photos came out great. Then the batteries started discharging after only about one day. It was within the time limit of themreturn policy, so I was able to return it for a full refund. Figuring that it was just one bad apple, I ordered another of the same model. This one has worked OK for about 6 weeks, but now is doing the same thing! It's over the limit in the return policy, so I'm stuck with it. Now I need another camera, but won't order another one of these!

Reviews.Title: Unhappy
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera new for a trip to Florida and used it a couple of times just to try it out. First time we used it on our trip it broke. We missed many photo opportunities. Contacted Canon and sent it back for repairs They could not repair it so they sent me a refurbished one instead of a new one. If I had wanted a refurbished camera I could have bought one initially and save money. Just more crap made in China! I'm done with Canon.

Reviews.Title: Uses AA batteries
Reviews.Author: Karen M. Smith
Reviews.Content: One of the few left that uses AA batteries was primary reason for choice.  We like to use rechargeable Ni Metal Hydride batts for use in a simple point and shoot use.  Works good and provides reasonable results too!

Reviews.Title: Compact camera with optical viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Spike
Reviews.Content: This camera is exactly what my research showed me. It would have been nice to have a more powerful zoom but the important feature is the optical viewfinder. It is difficult to take action pictures without the aid of at least a optical viewfinder. The viewfinder works well with the optical zoom but not the digital zoom. All in all very happy with the purchase thus far.

Reviews.Title: good for the money
Reviews.Author: Arturo
Reviews.Content: Good pics easy to operate, I'd buy another one. For the money its a good buy. I need 4 more words it says..

Reviews.Title: This is a Canon???
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Pics never come out as I hoped. Flash takes forever to re-charge, thus missing many good shots. It's ok in a pinch, but do yourself a favor and get a REAL camera.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Marcus "Mark"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Bought this camera for an older parent and it has been great and so easy to use. Basic settings and easy to point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Delivered Everything I thought it would.
Reviews.Author: Carl Angotti
Reviews.Content: Great Camera, easy to use. I wanted an optical viewer, and this one had it, and it works well. Pictures are great.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Bantz
Reviews.Content: I do a lot of hiking and needed a small camera with some zoom and this fits the bill.  Has a lot of features I have tried some out like  fisheye and fireworks with good results.  I don't always get good results with macro but many are insects who don't pose for you.

Reviews.Title: Ecellent!
Reviews.Author: Jack Simmons
Reviews.Content: All three of the engineers are happy with the camera especially the close detail that can be taken with tha camera.Jack

Reviews.Title: Nice camera at a good price
Reviews.Author: Jame Reed "vista cruiser"
Reviews.Content: A nice compact camera at a reasonable price that shoots nice high-definition videos. I purchased this for my daughter's birthday and she loves it.

Reviews.Title: It's fine
Reviews.Author: Tara Cadley "T"
Reviews.Content: Takes good pictures. A little slow between shots, but otherwise fine. I did an 11x13 enlargement of one of the photos, and it came out very nice. I'm not doing anything fancy, just snapshots, so it works fine, and the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: VERY HAPPY
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: I JUST RECEIVED MY SILVER A1300 AND HAVE BEEN TRIED DIFFERENT SETTINGS.SO FAR I AM VERY PLEASED. THE ORDER WAS SHIPPED PROMPTLY AND TO SAY I AM VERYHAPPY.IT WILL TAKE SOME TIME TO GET USE TO, BUT WOULD RECOMMEND TO ALL.I ALSO ORDERED 16GB SD CARD AND TWO YEAR SERVICE CONTRACT. A MUST.

Reviews.Title: Value Camera with Viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Frank H Conner III
Reviews.Content: Great value! In the bright sunlight you need a viewfinder and this is the only camera in this price range that has one. Takes good pictures too!!!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A 1300
Reviews.Author: Gladys H. Mainor
Reviews.Content: This little camera takes excellent pictures! You don't need to be a good photographer, the camera does all the work, just point & click. I promise you will love it. I recommend it for the novice and experienced.

Reviews.Title: Buy it!
Reviews.Author: Maria Bros "The Bee Charmer"
Reviews.Content: I was showing my camera to a friend yesterday. She just had bought another brand, adn paid over 150 dollars. My camera was ten times better than hers, and I paid 60 bucks on black friday specials! This camera has great resolution, the colors look perfect, and the video is hd. It's small, which makes it very practical to carry around. Why pay more when you can get it all for $120? Buy it!

Reviews.Title: Canon for taking pics of radio control aircraft in the air.
Reviews.Author: Durwood B. Humphreys "WA4ZBP"
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find a camera with a viewfinder anymore, and I also like dry cell batteries, instead of charging.  I photograph radio control aircraft in the air, and it is impossible to keep the plane in the display in the sunlight, but with the view finder I can keep the aircrfaft in the center of the picture.Great Camera..

Reviews.Title: just started using
Reviews.Author: Jan Prust
Reviews.Content: I like the fact that this camera uses AA batteries and is still quite small.  I have taken several pictures now and am happy with the quality.  My only concern is that when using the flash it needs to be recharged for a few seconds before the next picture.  Haven't quite figured out why yet.

Reviews.Title: Very compact little camera
Reviews.Author: M. Afzal
Reviews.Content: As a once, almost professional, and now just amateur photographer who bought this camera right before a vacation, I have been quite happy.- The rechargeable batteries I use last a long time.- You can choose from a lot of preset settings or customize them- The customization options are endless and easy to maneuver- Just like all Canon point-and-shoots, they have a similar setup, so as a Canon user, I found it a breeze to navigate.- The photos, once printed, come out wonderfully!Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: mark j. zamora
Reviews.Content: I did my research and my comparisons with other cameras before I decided to go with the A1300.  When I received it it was exactly what all the reviews said it was and would do.  I am very satisfied with this camera and with all of the features that it has.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph Yergler
Reviews.Content: It was time for an upgrade from my old 4 megapixel camera and two things were important to me in a new camera.1.  Must have a viewfinder so I can correctly crop my picture in sunlight.  I can hardly see the screen on cameras and cellphones when using them in the sunlight.2.  I preferred replaceable batteries so I don't have to fiddle with charging while traveling.I don't need a lot of options but want my camera to have the basic anyway. This camera has plenty of settings.The A1300 has a 5x optical zoom and a digital zoom out to 20x.  I especially like the fact that with 16 MP the digital zoom is useful compared to my 4 MP camera which pixelated quickly. Picture quality very good for a point-n-shoot.I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: CANON POWERSHOT A 1300 16.0 MP
Reviews.Author: Ronald Jackson
Reviews.Content: This is the camera I carry with me almost all the time and it does a great job - pictures are clear and concise and the camera fits into a shirt pocket - uses "AA" batteries which seem to last a long time. The asset I like the best is it has a viewfinder. More and more cameras nowdays at the lower price range come without a viewfinder and, outdoors, they become pretty useless trying to see the display in outdoor light. I also have a Canon SX500 IS which I bought for long distance photos - is 16.0 MB with a 30X zoom and takes great pictures but...long distance is normally outdoors and it has no viewfinder - often can't see the image in the display so you don't see what you are taking a photo of. I find that disappointing and find I don't use it as I may wish because of that. The A 1300, however, is a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: A bit disappointing
Reviews.Author: Judit Campbell
Reviews.Content: Photos came out consistently over-exposed, and it does not seem possible to adjust settings to correct. Because of this I used less and less on overseas trip. Close-ups of flowers were better, at least. iPhone took far better photos. Sadly, can't recommend.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Nonsha
Reviews.Content: Biggest peice of grabage I ever brought. I loved Canon, and have owed 4 other previous versions of Canon Cameras, but this one is CRAP. Picture in anything other than sunlight are blury, grainy, and junk. Resolution is sad. I stopped using it and brought a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Died after 6 months
Reviews.Author: TwoNiner "msides8"
Reviews.Content: After six months of light use the camera lense can no longer focus on any objects and all the photos are blurry as a result. I'm very disappointed at the quality of Canon cameras and now I'm out the money I put towards this one. I'll probably go back to Nikon for my next hand held. The new SLR I'm shopping for won't be a Canon that's for sure!

Reviews.Title: No printed user guide
Reviews.Author: embh
Reviews.Content: I have yet to take pictures with this camera, bought as a backup so I had another with optical view.  If I would have seen there was no printed user guide I probably would not have purchased.  What happens to people that purchase this and do not have access to a computer?  The enclosed CD isn't something I wanted, so now that I see what it contains will remove from the download, I did go on line to find a user guide could download.  At least show what isn't included, ie the printed manual.

Reviews.Title: Just getting to know the camera
Reviews.Author: Edith Tefft
Reviews.Content: Just getting to know the camera,few family pictures I have taken have been great. I was a little disappointed with the zoom or lack there of and then I found it and all is great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Vicki P
Reviews.Content: I needed to replace my old camera and wanted something simple. I am not a photographer, just needed a good point and shoot for snapshots. After checking reviews online, I felt Canon would be best for me. I was looking at a different model, but the unbelievable price on this one got my attention. The camera has been great for my purposes. I have been very happy with the photo quality and ease of use. I used the macro setting to photograph a rose to send to someone in hopes of identifying the cultivar, and the pictures were wonderful. The biggest drawback to this camera is that it does not come with an instruction manual. That comes on a disk which you would need to print out for a hard copy. I haven't done that yet but really need to. I much prefer having a paper copy of the manual that I can take with me. Other than that, I have no complaints. Now if you are into photography, I cannot tell you if this camera would be any good for that, but if you want an inexpensive point and shoot that takes good snapshots, this camera will do the job.

Reviews.Title: All things considered, a great little point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Dwegs "Dwegs"
Reviews.Content: This was purchased for my wife, who cannot shoot at arms length (like you have to with most digital P&S; cams now) and will not spend time to "learn" a camera.Perfectly usable for this type of person. I provides decent pictures in most cases, albeit a little on the processed side. Considering the image quality, and features, this is a no brainer.We purchased it used for about 3/4 of the new price, and that makes it a steal for someone who wants a P&S; camera with a normal viewfinder (but it is on the tiny size).I would purchase it again for this purpose.

Reviews.Title: I love Canon Cameras.
Reviews.Author: Rachel T
Reviews.Content: I carry my camera(s) around everywhere so they tend to get a bit banged up.So far, Canon camera's are the most resilient and I have had the least amount of problems with them.Lightweight, clear images, fantastic photos.

Reviews.Title: Good first timer
Reviews.Author: James andrew Hinds Jr.
Reviews.Content: This was a gift to my wife to take pictures of our new grandaughter.  Great camera for a first timer.

Reviews.Title: quick great images and practical to carry
Reviews.Author: pedalpusher
Reviews.Content: small and practical, when you don't want to carry your bulky SLR but yet want to have good pictures, this is the way to go, just slip it in your pocket/purse, don't expect a great flash, play around with it to know its limitations, once you're used to it, you'll find it is easy to handle and will get amazing results despite of its size

Reviews.Title: PERFECT
Reviews.Author: S. Hardwick "Big Steve"
Reviews.Content: This was a very good deal, shipped promptly and undamaged. This little camera does it all, I am STILL learning all the things it can do. One word of advice go to HD mode if you want to enlarge a few pics, (at a distance zoomed in some were a little grainy).Switching to HD solved that problem, I use the HD 8 memory card and can knock out over 1000 pics. or HD gives me over 800.Very happy with this camera and very easy to transport, it's almost like carrying nothing at all!Would buy again! A++

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1300 16.0 MP
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Travis
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the phone. It's easy to use and takes quality great pictures. Great zoom feature. I would highly recommend this phone to anyone. A lot of camera for the price. It's small enough so you can take it anywhere.Thank you.

Reviews.Title: power shot A1300
Reviews.Author: Becky Barrette
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Canon PowerShot A1300. I took it on a trip and all the outside pictures came out good, but the inside ones esp at night are not clear or sharp at all. Also blurry esp if the kids moved. Is there a setting for inside or an action setting for taking pictures of kids moving? Just wondering, before I return. Any advice would be great!

Reviews.Title: too complicated for easy use ...
Reviews.Author: Stephen Wolgast
Reviews.Content: I have an older Canon Powershot A470 and have had great experience with it.  So, I bought my wife the A1300 thinking it would be similar but better.  It is intended for video gamers and smart-phone users.  You have to pick through a number of menus just to force the flash in poor light.  My wife refused to use it.  I gave her my A470 and figured I would educate myself on the newer model.  It is testing my patience.  There are so many menus and modes that it is totally frustrating.  Not only that, but the menu logic is not consistent, so it's hard to get back to the selections you had before.  It is complicated enough, that the manual is inadequate.  If you follow the instructions in the manual exactly, it may not work they way they indicate.I like the image quality and the optical viewfinder, but I curse every time I use it.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Cookie Day
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  So easy to use and understand.  Makes great pictures. I use it almost every day.  I would highly recommend this camera for anyone who just wants to take pictures without complication!!!

Reviews.Title: It took beautiful pictures
Reviews.Author: Lotus
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera. It took beautiful pictures; however I ended up returning it because I found one that was less heavy, offered way more features and options for taking pictures, and had panoramic picture shot options. All in all though, for simple, yet nice pictures, this does the job wonderfully!!

Reviews.Title: Cheap
Reviews.Author: Smorado262
Reviews.Content: I had this camera a short time before it broke-stopped working.  I guess you get what you pay for.  This is an example.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted!
Reviews.Author: Sassy Pantalones
Reviews.Content: What I was looking for in a new camera was:  -An optical viewfinder  -An easy to use point and shoot  -Small and light enough to carry in my pocketThis one fit the bill for me.  I was amazed how difficult it was to find a camera in this price range with a view finder.  It is so much easier than a monitor when I am in bright sunlight.  Thank you Canon!It takes great pictures and videos with minimal effort on my part.  Yes, I am lazy.It is very lightwight and I am able to stuff it anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Purchased after reading many reviews of cameras in this $ range
Reviews.Author: richard josselyn
Reviews.Content: My last  didgital camera broke after many years of use ( Nikon coolplex L 18 ) so I started researching something around the same size and price range. After reading many reviews of different cameras in the 100 to150 dollar price range I kept coming back to the Canon a1300... I read at least 10 reviews of this camera and no one seem to have anything bad to say about it so i made my choice.  I've used it in many different lighting situations including a indoor concert and outside in bright lighting, etc.. and downloaded the pics onto my computer.  I have to say I'm very impressed!  Glad I read the reviews and suggest to anyone looking for a camera in this price range that they wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Easy point & shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Dennis Drews
Reviews.Content: Great product & prompt delivery.  Gave as a gift to a young family just starting out & they've enjoyed taking pictures of their first child.

Reviews.Title: My inexpensive Canon PowerShotA1300 takes great pictures.
Reviews.Author: Kit Kaplan
Reviews.Content: It is small,fits in my purse,convenient and inexpensive.The best feature is the viewfinder which I use frequently since the image on the screen can be difficult to see when out in the sun.

Reviews.Title: nice little camera
Reviews.Author: deel4
Reviews.Content: nice pocket size camera. bigger viewing area than my last one and it takes nice little videos the only thing I don't like but I can deal with it is it uses double A batteries and they get used up quickly it would be nice if it had none of those flat batteries they are more expensive but they last longer

Reviews.Title: For snapshots and documentation--  artsy photos, not so much...
Reviews.Author: guitar zero
Reviews.Content: This camera is okay for ordinary stuff.  But the pictures it takes are just okay-- not nearly as good as the ones I got with my old, comparably priced Sony camera. The images are not as sharp, the colors not as deep.

Reviews.Title: OK for still life
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Miller "scoutldr"
Reviews.Content: The significant shutter lag renders it useless for the purpose I bought it...to take snapshots of my very active 2 year old grandaughter.  Every shot is "too late"...

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Bixby Jim
Reviews.Content: This is the only point and shoot camera that I could find that had a view finder. I had another Canon that was a step above, was faster and took better pictures but without a viewfinder it was worthless outside in the sunshine.  With an editing program like Picasa this camera is adequate.

Reviews.Title: Handy little camera for backpacking
Reviews.Author: Canyon Hiker "Hit the Trail"
Reviews.Content: Nice, lightweight little camera with intuitive controls. Take nice photos of a surprising resolution. I've always taken my larger camera on backpacking trips so that I could be sure to get good shots. I think this camera will be taking its place! Nice surprise. :)

Reviews.Title: No maual, no sim card
Reviews.Author: Scotty
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my father. I have an older version of this camera, and has been great. It is industrial proof too. I was disappointed it came with no manual or sim card. My father does not have a computer so i had to print all 186 pages and mail it to him.  It also came with no sim card so I had to buy one and send it as well. My older version has a dial on the top to change settings, which was so easy on the fly. This version is similar to my Canon Rebel T3 which is menu driven on the screen. For an a older person with few computer skills, this has been a challenge, but he has gotten better.  This camera also is the only pocket digital that still has a view finder, and for an older school photographer like my pop, it has made going to digital easier. If you want a workhorse camera that you can hold, this will do the job

Reviews.Title: Great compact digital camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Adrian D. Lee "ALee"
Reviews.Content: Great compact digital camera!!! Fits in your pocket, reasonable priced, tand ake great pictures. I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great gift for the money
Reviews.Author: Meek2828
Reviews.Content: My wife really likes this camera.It is small with a nice sized screen, a low profile,excellent range and picture clarity.With a good set of rechargable batteries this camera is nice to have around.

Reviews.Title: Opticall viewfinder is VERY handy!
Reviews.Author: John Persons
Reviews.Content: After Canon's previous camera like this was disconinuted I was forced to buy a different product with no optical viewfinder.. But I kept waiting for another product like this from Canon. When it finally became available we bought it for a niece. She loves it as much as we do.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: John Butcher
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, lots of features, compact.  Fits easy in your pocket.has features even my moe expensiveDigital lacks. John

Reviews.Title: CAMERA
Reviews.Author: ActionOkie
Reviews.Content: EXACTLY WHAT I WNATED. PERFECT.. i HAVE USED IT VERY MUCH AND VERY OFTEN AND IT IS DOING GREAT. IF AND WHEN IT GOES, I WILL GET ANOTHER ONE

Reviews.Title: Awesome for the price
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: This camera came fast. It works like it should for the price. Good quality pictures overall. Can't wait to use it on my vacation coming up. Great buy

Reviews.Title: Good Product for the price.
Reviews.Author: Erin R. Crouch
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon Rebel and I love it.  I am a Digital Photography teacher and I have used many cameras.  I find Canons to be the most user friendly.  This one is no different!  I bought it for my mom and dad.  They needed a new digital camera (their old one was only 5 megapixels) that was easy to use.  I gave this to them for Christmas and they love it.  This would be a great camera for a teen, too.

Reviews.Title: View Finder is Nice Touch!
Reviews.Author: Tony E. Jackson
Reviews.Content: Great all around camera for those that need a light weight design and ease of use. Settings are easy to use and find. Buy, Buy and Buy!

Reviews.Title: Super camera
Reviews.Author: luv2shop
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my teenage daughter after her Kodak got broken.  This has been the perfect camera.  Not to expensive but has great features for the price.  Would definitely buy this again.

Reviews.Title: Great camera in a small package.
Reviews.Author: Frank C. Orifici
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera with lots of features at a very reasonable price. It takes great pictures, is easy to use, has both digital and conventional view finder, and best of all uses AA batteries!

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: Norman L. Orloff "Normando $"
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot has it's good features and bad. The best feature, of course, is that it has a SLR view finder, the reason I bought it. The poor feature is that the lens doesn't take the photo until about two seconds after I push the button. This allows for only totally still shots.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Derek
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace old digital camera. Takes very clear pictures and video. The zoom is pretty good as well.

Reviews.Title: Great for travel!
Reviews.Author: sea mac
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to Turkey.  It's compact, but that does not mean the controls are hard to use.  I keep it on automatic as I'm learning to use it.  Great quality photos.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price. The viewfinder really makes it.
Reviews.Author: John Biskup
Reviews.Content: I've looked for a long time for a digital camera with a viewfinder. It makes it so much easier to take pics. in bright light.

Reviews.Title: Wifes toy
Reviews.Author: John De Marco Jr.
Reviews.Content: I really like the camera. I have other Canon cameras but this on is by far the easiest to work. The battery life is not really great and that is my only complaint.I bought it for its simplicity,

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Orson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this camera for our honeymoon to Hawaii.  We had a sony cybershot but the screen cracked about a week before our trip so we needed a decent replacement camera that would fit a last minute budget.  For $100 it was one of the best cameras we have ever purhcased and it took wonderful, clear, good quality pictures.  Not having a charger was kind of a drag, but we just made sure we took lots of extra batteries when we went on excursions (I didn't use any more than 4 batteries on a fully day of picture taking) and the pictures were great.  I will say that this camera worked best in bright day light hours and it seemed like a lot of the pictures taken around dusk tended to come out a little blurry.  I also noticed that the more I zoomed in on something those pictures tended to be a little more blurry and I took about 3 - 4 pictures of the same thing to get a clear one - but hey - its a digital camera so just delete what you don't want. I still ended up with some pretty amazing pictures.  My husband enjoyed the video feature - which takes great videos -  just make sure you by a memory card big enough to take video too.  At the end of the day, a Canon camera for $100 is a greal deal no matter what.

Reviews.Title: Very nice and all expect ions from the other reviews  I read before purchase.
Reviews.Author: Stanley Hartman
Reviews.Content: Have no used it much yet,but so far very pleased,and will be used more when the weather gets better and will be outside.

Reviews.Title: Modern technology
Reviews.Author: M. L. Dunn
Reviews.Content: We love this little camera. We were 35mm enthusiasts, but since we got this little gem, there's no going back. And it takes a real nice video as well. I would really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Battery Error, again!
Reviews.Author: C. L. Taylor
Reviews.Content: I had a PowerShot A540 that suddenly didn't see new batteries. I had read online that it could not be fixed and decided to try the Powershot A1300 HD.After 4 weeks and two uses, the A1300 had the same error. Changing the batteries to fresh ones does not clear it. There is no secondary battery (button style) that I could find.I'm, needless to say, VEEEEERY disapointed.  :(  Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: I have been used it for my job
Reviews.Author: Renato "Renato"
Reviews.Content: Canon camera is good for my job, it is easy to use, practical.One thing that I don't like it's that the flash tooks some time to charge betwen pictures.I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Does what I need it to do.
Reviews.Author: Richard P. Grossman
Reviews.Content: A good camera that allows me to point and shoot and continue on. Good quality, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Arrived Quickly
Reviews.Author: Stacy Bozzo
Reviews.Content: I have not had a chance to use this yet but the few pictures I have taken have come out very clear.

Reviews.Title: So close yet still shooting itself in the foot
Reviews.Author: B. Levine "TheMacGuy"
Reviews.Content: I own an older Canon A590 which has been a real workhorse for us on a number of vacations. Well, it had to be repaired and, while it's still chugging along, I knew we'd have to replace it sooner rather than later. As my wife and I both require a viewfinder (using the LCD just isn't comfortable), our choices in the reasonable price range are quite limited. This A1300 seemed to be the logical replacement for the A590.The Good:-Higher resolution pictures than what was available on the A590 (16 vs 9). It's not as huge a difference as it sounds unless you are cropping excessively and then it's handy.-Truly pocketable. Feels about 60% the size of the A590.-AA batteries and SD card. -Standard- stuff you can find anywhere.-Nice flash. Fairly powerful considering its size (and do remember you can't be across the parking lot and have the flash do anything).-Great viewfinder. Obviously, close-up you have to watch for parallax error but that's when the rear LCD should be used.The Bad:-It's possible the camera is -too- small to handle well. The A590 had a really pronounced grip whereas what passes for a grip on the A1300 is really just the bulge where the AA's and SD card reside.-Only one serious design flaw. When shooting video, zooming is purely digital so any zooming in results in extreme pixelation. You'll have to stop the video, zoom in optically, then re-start the video in order to have an "optical telephoto" result instead of that awful digital zoom. Why Canon engineers chose to go down this path is just a mystery. The 720p video without digital zoom is tack-sharp and certainly could have been the basis of a killer digicam-corder. At this price, I could have pointed at expensive DSLRs and laughed. As it is, however, the camcorder function is mediocre simply because of the lack of optical zoom during shooting. What a disappointment.Bottom Line: I bought the camera for the stills and considered the 720p video a bonus. However, with the digital zoom producing unacceptable video, I'll still need a camcorder (or a decent bridge camera like the Fuji XS1 which can do it all, albeit in a considerably larger size).

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1300 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Carol A Trow
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be reasonable camera to have handy to catch those on the spot pics, but it is the worst camera to set up a photo or video.  The buttons are confusing and I have never been able to set it up properly. The instructions that came with it are crap. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Nice product
Reviews.Author: Jimbo
Reviews.Content: I have only had it a couple weeks, but takes very nice photos. Easy to use and just feels good in your hand. I really like it.

Reviews.Title: Decent
Reviews.Author: Nick Cincotta "DINO MAN"
Reviews.Content: This is a decent camera. The pics come out a little red and a little grainy from time to time.flash take a while to recharge

Reviews.Title: fuzzy focus
Reviews.Author: JACKIE HILL
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small camera to tuck in a bag for instant of the moment pics.  The photos were fuzzy and even though I tried two different labs for printing it was the same.  I have a Canon EOS and it is too big to drag around.  I returned the camera and received my refund instantly.  Thank you for a good return policy.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: The picture is super clear.  The only reason I didn't rate it 5 stars is bc the shutter speed is kind of slow & I have kids so keeping them still is a bit of a trick.  In all honesty I never read the manual, so if anyone knows how to change that let me know.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: n2cats
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son and daughter-n-law so that they could take pictures of his new twins!  It has proved to be really easy to set up and use.  The picture quality is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: This item was just as it was described- I gave this item as a gift and the recipient loved it!

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: N. A. Weinzettel
Reviews.Content: This is fine for my purposes, which is occasional use.  The instructions are easy to follow...good for me as I'm a novice.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: happy customer
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this item has amazing picture quality and video quality, not too much, comes pretty, fast and has great durability, extremely happy with this item. I would recommend this to you!!!  Canon PowerShot A1300 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 5x Digital Image Stabilized Zoom 28mm Wide-Angle Lens and 720p HD Video Recording (Black)

Reviews.Title: Camera Finally
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Fiore Naranjo "alfiorejo"
Reviews.Content: Good Choise to this kind of product. I recommended it 100% . . . . . . . . .

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: D. Lange "JAGMAN"
Reviews.Content: For a rather inexpensive camera, it has an amazing number of features.  I especially appreciate the view finder for use on bright sunny days ... it is one of the few cameras that still has a view finder.  The screen is not as large as some others but it is large enough to view the optional setting that may be set easily.  This is a great camera for a beginner and for those of us who do not want to carry a larger, more cumbersome unit.  It takes great, very clear movies.  You will love it!

Reviews.Title: Great transaction
Reviews.Author: J. Green
Reviews.Content: Great camera, easy to use, small enough to carry around. The only thing I don't love about it is the time it takes to charge the flash before taking a picture...but it's not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value.
Reviews.Author: Harold
Reviews.Content: The Canon Powershot A1300 is a lot of camera for the money.  Picture quality is excellent and menu layout is logical.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality questionable
Reviews.Author: SirGeorge
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for several weeks, and I like the design, the optical viewfinder, the AA battery feature and the immediate controls, especially being able to go into movie mode right from the start, no menu-searching. I have a large SLR package, but wanted a small pocket camera to always have with me. This seemed a good choice, especially on sale with Amazon. Once I started looking at the resolution, however, I was quite disappointed. My 5MP phone camera resolves much better than this lens. Having 16 Megapixels is a complete waste, since upon enlarging, the lens image degrades long before the need for 16MP. I reduced the image size to 8MP, and even that is more than this lens needs. Maybe I just have a lemon - the other reviewers don't mention this issue as being serious. I will likely replace it with something else, being a stickler for sharpness, but it won't be a Canon.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good . . .
Reviews.Author: fish
