Reviews.Content: Haven't had a good chance to try out everything yet, so rating could go up or down a star.  However, one thing I don't care for is I cannot find any way to force a flash.  As near as I can tell, it is either on "auto" or "off".  A forced flash is helpful in lighting up a near subject when their background is very bright (thus, auto tells camera to not flash), and of course, the "off" gives the same result . . . a very light background, and a dim or black subject.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional Camera
Reviews.Author: Conrad P. Zahn "Woodworker"
Reviews.Content: We recently was on a cruise and this camera took great pictures. I was use to using a view finder and the camers has it all without spending hundreds of dollars for a good quality camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: N. Lawson
Reviews.Content: Perfect size for me. I love that it uses AA batteries and doesn't have to be recharged and has a viewfinder which makes it so much easier to use in bright light.  Haven't used it much yet but look forward to taking it with me when I travel.

Reviews.Title: A Great Holiday Gift!!
Reviews.Author: Bruce Keller
Reviews.Content: My wife really enjoys taking outdoor pictures in rural settings and this camera was a perfect gift. I will be buying additional accessories shortly.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Gil Johnson
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, came in early,works great.  Disappointed Qin price, I was charged $5.00 more on Amazon than what I could have bought it for from Cannon.  I purchase a lot from Amazon, but I will check prices closer from now on.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: L. Null
Reviews.Content: We bought this for my MIL who often has problems with technology.  She has had no problems using this camera, as it is very user friendly.  It takes great pictures as well.

Reviews.Title: Best Little Camera
Reviews.Author: D.R. Agon
Reviews.Content: I use for taking shots on my hikes.  The movie feature lets me shot the waves crashing on the beach with sound and the still shots for scenary.  I really like the view finder because I get to compose the shot eaier than with the display.

Reviews.Title: Make sure you buy the insurance, because the camera will die!
Reviews.Author: TomR "Tom at Amazon"
Reviews.Content: I think this Canon A1300 is a fabulous little camera, so why only a 1-star rating? Because it is quite likely to fail on you, so make sure you also pay for the $20 comprehensive 2-yr insurance, and beware if this is the only camera you take with you for a special event!Below is a copy/paste of my updated review of Canon's two predecessor models that failed on me. The only reason I have bought yet-another Canon camera is because in this camera size this was the only model I could find that includes a VIEWFINDER - which I consider indispensable.+++++++++++++++++++++++I really loved this Canon A1200 camera, great functions, superb photos, etc. While other cameras in this size and price range have similar features and image quality, this is the ONLY camera I could find that has a VIEWFINDER!But suddenly, within 9 months of only sporadic use the photos became useless because of yellow streaks all over. Previously I had a similar experience with a Canon PowerShot SD800 IS that suddenly produced magenta streaks. Neither camera was dropped or abused, thus my conclusion is that Canon's image sensors include a high percentage of defective units! Unfortunately I had not kept the warranty stuff on file, thus it was a total loss in both instances. (Unfortunately this Amazon product review system doesn't seem to provide an opportunity to upload illustrative photos.)Live and learn, because of the viewfinder I have just bought an A1300, but this time I also bought bought the $20 two-year comprehensive insurance and will make sure I keep all the documentation on file. This brought my total cost to about $150 which I consider pricey, but paid the price in order to have a viewfinder.PS- Because both failures were drastic and sudden, beware if this is the only camera you take on a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, good name
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Peck
Reviews.Content: Good little camera for quick shots to document my work.  Gave 4 out of 5 stars because the LCD on my 1st one crapped out in less than 2 weeks.  Amazon replaced it no questions asked and even threw in 2 day shipping!

Reviews.Title: Great for seniors and other non-techies
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Dad. He can barely turn his computer on! He always has difficulty with everything electronic, so my concern was finding a simple to use camera. It has been a couple of months and he has had a blast! The viewfinder is good for people who have never used a digital camera.

Reviews.Title: One bad feature
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: Don't like cameras that use penlight batteries. Even the best penlight batteries do not last as long as a rechargeable lithium-ion battery.

Reviews.Title: quick and easy
Reviews.Author: J. Biederstedt
Reviews.Content: works great and easy to use.  even the children used it during the xmas season takes nice pictures, and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Song Siren
Reviews.Content: Has everything I wanted.  Because it is limited as far as hard buttons, it does take some getting used to the soft button aspect of the hard buttons, but it is doable.  A plenty neat product, especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Aquariansheep
Reviews.Content: Soooo I originally bought this camera just to take super quick snapshots; i.e. - the dog doing silly things, a bird out the window, a goofy profile pic, etc. - but I wound up using it for so much more. This camera is so awesome I actually took it abroad with me to use while I was vacationing to take landscape scenes and more. I never owned a Canon before, and now I don't think I will own anything else.

Reviews.Title: Excellent price range.
Reviews.Author: M. C.
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased to have found this camera in a good price range.  It works very well for what I need it for.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: JR-Texas
Reviews.Content: We got this for our granddaughter for Christmas.  She loves taking pictures with it.  It's small and fits in a small case we bought to go with it.  Easy to use and takes great pictures.  It has lots of shooting modes and fun capabilities for manipulating pictures.  Also does a good job with videos.

Reviews.Title: Purchased for elderly parents
Reviews.Author: boyd
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my elderly parents (over 80) due to the fact that it has a view finder in addition to the screen.  It is easy for them to use and they love that they can take the whole camera to the store to have pictures viewed on screen for their print selection.  They also like that they do not have to charge a battery, but can use off the shelf batteries.  I higly recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot Cameras
Reviews.Author: Jayhawk
Reviews.Content: Canon's Powershot series of cameras are fantastic 'friends and events' cameras.  I have been using this series for years.  My most recent Powershot purchase was the A1300.  It creates good photographs and the video quality is amazing.  My hearing isn't great but whenever I take videos with this Canon camera, I am able to hear the subject perfectly even if I wasn't able to while taking the videos.  For me, it's always Canon.....

Reviews.Title: Pictures are not great compares to other 16.0 MP camera.
Reviews.Author: binhvu
Reviews.Content: Attracting by the price (it was $59.00) I bought two for my nieces. The camera is compact, easy to hold and operate by one hand. It is good for casual picture taking. I don't like to wait for 5 seconds for the flash to recharges after a shot, even with a new set of battery. I found out that I missed a lot of good picture because it did not go off while waiting for the flash to recharge. The picture quality is not that great compare to other cameras in the same 16.0 MP class. But for the price, I think it's a decent camera to bring around trips, parties... and not afraid of breaking it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: K. L. Baker "baker books"
Reviews.Content: I needed a small reliable camera and this was recommended by my brother. I love it. My mom even bought one too!

Reviews.Title: Canon
Reviews.Author: T. Rieger "Tee"
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot A1300 16.0 MP Digital Camera takes good pictures and the clarity is great. We are enjoying the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Hiker12
Reviews.Content: This little camera is good buy for the times when you are in places where you don't want to take an expensive camera - primarily high action type adventures.  The pictures are a good quality though when in flash mode on a rare occasion the picture might come out grainy.

Reviews.Title: A Bit Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Robertine Mc Donald
Reviews.Content: I thought that I was gettung rechargeable batteries, one which I could leave in and not taking out everytime I'm not using it and also I didn't know that it was hard plastic.

Reviews.Title: got it early
Reviews.Author: earlman123
Reviews.Content: got it early and it was a gift and my wife loves it, it is just what I ordered and its very user friendly...

Reviews.Title: Good accessory camera for me
Reviews.Author: James Percy "Gumbydoc"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a backup for a 35mm camera, taken on a three week trip to Asia. Performed very well. Sharp, durable. Good exposure. Great price.

Reviews.Title: cannon a3100
Reviews.Author: ewq
Reviews.Content: Not good. The images are blurry while taking photos. Need to press the click button to stabilize the image. Though the clicked photo quality is good.

Reviews.Title: Okay but not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Christopher Zobel
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a Christmas present and it worked very well for a few weeks. The picture quality was very good. But then it got put on my bedside table near the humidifier. A few days later I got it out and it had water under the screen.I would say that I would have preferred a rechargeable battery though instead of two AA batteries.Also to say, this camera is NOT WATERPROOF.

Reviews.Title: Great pix and very user friendly
Reviews.Author: Byron Lasseter
Reviews.Content: This camera is super for a novice or a professional.The "AA" batteries are a plus as is the viewfinder. Great deal - great price.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: jrg
Reviews.Content: Can't go wrong with a Canon product and although I have not used it yet I am happy with the quality

Reviews.Title: great camera but...
Reviews.Author: Steve W
Reviews.Content: My only problem is I failed to closely read the description.It requires AA batteriesFor my situation I would spend a few bucks more and get a similar Canon rechargeable with Li Ion batteries and charger.That is what I did.  The rechargeable model takes 100s of pictures before needing to be recharged and the battery is lighter.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the price
Reviews.Author: David Thompsen
Reviews.Content: I use this for work everyday. It's cheap and takes great pics for the price. I got what I paid for!

Reviews.Title: One of my favorites
Reviews.Author: Carol Heard
Reviews.Content: Originally I bought the A1200 to carry on horseback. Liked it so well that I bought 4 more as gifts. This A1300 was a gift also.  One of my favorite things about this camera is that there is a viewfinder as well as the screen.  Seems like it's getting more difficult to find a little camera with that feature.

Reviews.Title: GREAT LITTLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Stephen Gochik "steveG"
Reviews.Content: For a camera this small and at such a grat price this has so many helpful features. I don,t like carrying my other cameras  everywhere I go but this is great, great pictures, great features. I would recommend this camera and have to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: beth m sommerfeld
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures. Easy to use. It was recommended by a friend of mine who had purchased one earlier.

Reviews.Title: More than just a camera!
Reviews.Author: Susan "cameocat24"
Reviews.Content: The features of this camera are awsome!  It takes great pictures with little effort and the learning curve is small.  Anyone can take an awsome picture.

Reviews.Title: Love it and picture quality is great!
Reviews.Author: Gazebo Lane
Reviews.Content: Portable, lightweight with great pics - would recommend. Like it so much better than my powershot A80 for quick pics.

Reviews.Title: The zoom is great
Reviews.Author: Makaleka "cooking connosieur"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to use outside during the day in various areas. It works well especially with the zoom lens which lets you take pictures from far away.  So far it has done everything it is supposed to do and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: Optical viewfinder was a key. LCD panels just do not cut it in the sun, outdoors.Quality if good; nice small size; very easy to use.Does nto quite replace my "lost" A570IS, but it works for the easy carry camera.

Reviews.Title: Probably the greatest present ever
Reviews.Author: A Mom
Reviews.Content: I got this as a Christmas present and it takes great pictures. I love all the features built into it and I can see myself using this for years to come!

Reviews.Title: xmas gift
Reviews.Author: Cari Witherspoon
Reviews.Content: Purchased for xmas.  The package was delivered on time and was in great condition.  The camera did not come with an SD card but that was my fault for not paying close enough attention when I bought the camera.  Used at xmas and works great.

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: Pattyo "Four of Seven"
Reviews.Content: This little camera is a smaller version of the PowerShot A560, which I have owned for 6 or 7 years.  So far, I don't see it performing as well as the larger sized version.  I do like the fact that it is smaller and easier to carry, and it also has a viewfinder (a necessity in Florida sunlight), but need more time to use it to know if I would recommend it.  The Christmas holidays kept us inside, as well as colder weather.I feel the price was excellent and hope it proves to be better than my older model, as it has more pixels and larger zoom features.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: rachael
Reviews.Content: i have waited for a camera that is easy for an "old woman" that wants to just point and shoot. i cannot see those silly lcd screens that all the new cameras only have. this has lcd screen but also a full size optical view finder. i have waited 2 years to find this option on an easy camera and cannon has done it! as i am not a "photographer" and my kids say that i am "technically challenged" i can use this, download the pictures, print them and enjoy taking pictures of family, animals etc. this is not a camera for "professional" pictures of the grand canyon, but my trip to a national park was caught enough to be enjoyable and show the beauty of the landscape.i am very pleased.oh yes and the other option i wanted was that it take regular AA batteries; which i purchased "rechargeable batteries" from retail store that last long and i love that option.

Reviews.Title: For anyone who grew up using 35 mm film cameras the Canon A1300 is a no-brainer
Reviews.Author: QuintBy
Reviews.Content: Having owned Nikons, Canons, Hasseblads and other 35 mm film SLRs for 45 years I had begun sizing down to simpler film cameras when digital cameras crossed over into the mainstream. I've long since stopped using film cameras and am using small point-in-shoot digital cameras due to the prohibitive cost of eSLRs.These small but increasingly sophisticated PnS digitals have much to be said for them, and I finally decided that instead of using my cell for casual shots I would keep a small digital camera that would reside in my glovebox.I picked this little Canon A1300 because it has something which virtually no digital camera priced under $300 has - an optical viewfinder. I know I'm old-fashioned but I still find awkward the need to use a digital display that requires distance between my eye and the camera.  When I found this A1300 I barely looked at any reviews or specs - the thought of having an optical viewfinder again made me believe, rightly it turns out, that I wasn't taking as many photos nor enjoy taking pictures as much using digital viewfinder.An optical viewfinder makes the 'shoot' in point-and-shoot a much faster process for me, and if you grew up during the pre-digital days I think this camera will do the same for you.Amended - A recent weekend at Asilomar on the Pacific coast -late March 2013, 63 degrees, sunny and no wind - proved up with no doubt the utility of an optical viewfinder. The ocean and beach are a non-starter for even the most adept digital viewfinders. The A1300 did not miss a beat and the technical quality of my photos was outstanding. Ignore the naysayers - if you want a trip back to optical viewfinder days (with the bonus of parallax adjustment) this may not be your only camera but it will be your favorite one.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1300 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 5x Digital Image...
Reviews.Author: EWG
Reviews.Content: It's a great little camera! I can carry it along all the time whereas my Nikon D200 although it is a great camera, is much too heavy for ordinary daily snapshots.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1300 16.0 MP cámara digital con imagen digital 5x ...
Reviews.Author: Hector Cocho
Reviews.Content: la cámara satisface mis expectativas llego en buen tiempo y me parece muy bueno el combo de estuche y memoria

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: john snyder
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the price, but I get fuzzy pictures sometimes when there is no motion. I wonder if the stabilizer is working correctly. My previous Canon didn't have this problem and it was a similiar camera. Otherwise I really like this camera for how it handles and all the different things it can do.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: bambidear
Reviews.Content: I was so happy to find a camera (and a Canon, no less!) that had a view finder and was reasonably priced. In fact, the price was great! I love my Canon Powershot S5SI from 2005. But, I wanted something a little smaller to fit in my purse for traveling. I have a Nikon, but it took terrible night shots. This Canon has done everything I expected it to do and more. Great pictures, especially on Micro. My night shots have been great. I can't wait to take it on my next vacation, along with my S5SI.

Reviews.Title: Takes good photos
Reviews.Author: Olivia
Reviews.Content: This takes good pics. Does everything a camera should do. Have rechargeable batteries because it does not come with any. Where the batteries insert, the camera is bulky. For a slimmer more modern camera, I would recommend the Canon PowerShot A2300 16.0 MP Digital Camera. Other than the batteries, this is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot
Reviews.Author: xmasden
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  Smaller than other one I bought a while back, but works about the same.....easy to get started with it.Takes fantastic pictures, but all the Canons I have bought do take great pictures.  The only problem I have had with Canon cameras is the lens retraction breaking.  (has happened on two different Canon cameras) I will have to see how this oneacts.

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: Dean
Reviews.Content: As an adjuster, I've used "point and shoot" cameras for tens of thousands of pictures. This camera is a good as any I've had. Work well, has held up better than most brands. Good value for the type. If you don't like this camera, you probably had the wrong expectations. I used rechargeables, that's why I want AA battery cameras and the battery life is comparable to others

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Linda Outterson
Reviews.Content: I needed a small digital camera for travel that would accept rechargeble batteries. Whenever I'm on the road - especially  outside the U.S. - it's such a hassle to find camera batteries. This camera allows me to recharge the batteries in the car. It's also "smart" enough to eliminate a lot of lighting and focusing problems that come with less expensive cameras. The viewing screen is a good size, too. Apparently this type of camera is becoming obsolete - I hope manufacturers consider keeping this style for folks like me.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: pepper
Reviews.Content: compact, takes good photos.  still working on how to use it  but that is not because it is difficult i just have not taken time to read the manual.  i like to photograph desert flowers, etc while hiking and this is great for that

Reviews.Title: Good solid camera
Reviews.Author: R.L.
Reviews.Content: Takes pictures in low light, bright light and everything in between w/o red eye or blurriness.  I especially like the 5X optical zoom.  One caveat - it does take a little longer to write to the SD card when shooting at 16 megapixels.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Celia Slagowski
Reviews.Content: I love looking thru the viewfinder to see the subject as well as having the little screen to see it.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: ray
Reviews.Content: A good camera for the price, feels good in my hand, I had a similar camera that was 10mp and this is 16, paid a lot more for the 10mp, so I guess I got a good deal on this one.

Reviews.Title: Way better than any cellphone camera.
Reviews.Author: Ian Norrish
Reviews.Content: Bought this recently to get wedding pictures of a friends wedding. I didn't want to trust my cellphone camera, which is convenient (8MP Android) but doesn't have all the bells and whistles of this easy to use camera.The results were outstanding. This model has a viewfinder (not common on the latest crop of cameras) which I personaaly prefer over the LED screen (particularly in bright light)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: So far, this camera has met all of my expectations.  Chose this one specifically for the viewfinder, and because Canon PowerShots have always performed well for me.  Easy to use and I love that the viewfinder zooms with the lens.  Very compact and could easily fit in my back pocket.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1300 - it is okay
Reviews.Author: Kelly Allen
Reviews.Content: The pictures are acceptable, but the battery life is extremely short. I love the size of the camera and how easy it is to use.

Reviews.Title: Good product!
Reviews.Author: Clee
Reviews.Content: My friend loved his Christmas gift!!  It was just what he needed for capturing family and vacation photos and more.

Reviews.Title: Insurance Adjuster Camera
Reviews.Author: B. Knutson
Reviews.Content: I needed to replace a cheapo Wally World Vivatar camera, that died after getting an entire 6 weeks of use out of, with something that uses AA batteries and has an SD card.I wanted something that could be considered disposable - something under $100 fits that description for me.This camera is excellent.  Feels solid in my hand, has an optical viewfinder to save on batteries, uses AA battery for easy replacement in a pinch, is small (pocketable), has a 5X optical zoom, a wide angle lens (take less shots to observe entire rooms/elevations), and has a decent flash.  All qualities that make it perfect for anyone using it for point-and-shoot professional purposes.  Professional as in insurance adjusters, real estate agents, construction estimators, building inspectors, the list goes on.As an added feature, you can take photos in 640x480 mode (Average of 75-100k/photo), so if you're a fellow insurance adjuster and you have to upload 100-200 photos at a crack, there's no post-processing to shrink them down to fit into your final report.Enjoy the camera.  I rarely ever write reviews but because of such a good experience with this camera I wanted to pass along my sentiments!

Reviews.Title: Easy and Great Photos
Reviews.Author: Intuitive Girl
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my 80 year old mom.  It needed to be easy, have batteries she could replace from her stash and connect to her computer and printer.  She is able to snap great photos and print them out with ease.  Mission accomplished.

Reviews.Title: We use this at work
Reviews.Author: Donna E Harrington
Reviews.Content: We use this camera at work and it works great!  I would recommend this camera for anyone needing something to document items shipped.

Reviews.Title: Viewfinder is a good point.
Reviews.Author: Lotustony
Reviews.Content: This is a satisfactory little handy-camera and I really appreciate it having a viewfinder which allows one to see what he's shooting in bright outside light.  I wish Canon would build a better battery/chip door latch . . I've had a Canon camera that died because of the latch part of the body failing . . This A1300 looks about the same design . . I still like Canon;  this is probably the 6th or 7th Canon I've owned including some top line film bodies.

Reviews.Title: Fair beginner camera
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I had some extra money this Christmas and decided to get a decent "beginners" camera, even ordering accessories to go with it.  I took about 20 test shots, and about 3 small 5-10 second test videos.  A few hours later I started it up again and it started to act strange - turning off randomly, screen freezing forcing me to restart it, and not always taking pictures.  It finally went off for good when I started it up the next morning.  The screen froze again and shut off.  So now the lens is stuck open, the power button isn't working, and I even changed 3 different sets of batteries with no luck.  I'm not a camera wizard and this is usually not my thing so I really don't know how to properly troubleshoot it.  This really is a bummer and I would get it replaced but it is currently out of stock.EDIT:  About five or six hours the original review, I was able to turn it on and has been functioning well since.  I'm not sure what happened before, but I hope it wont happen again.  In addition to the original review, I noticed it takes some time for the lens to focus, it's not a big deal but some might find it annoying.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot A1300
Reviews.Author: Diane Ellis
Reviews.Content: Actually don't know if this is the one I bought for me.  If so, it is simple to use and takes great pixs.I took it on a cruise before reading all the instructions and even without the instructions it proved easy to use.  Once I discovered how to use the close up feature I was able to get some great shots.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Solid Digital Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Amazon Shopper
Reviews.Content: For the price it works well. Occasionally the shot automation can produce some very strange results so experimentation is advised before any serious archival shots are committed to memory. The shot LED display is great but may not reflect what your picture will actually look like once saved depending on the scene settings. A Class 10 memory card is required for best results.Overall  the A1300 superseded by A2300 is a value driven remarkable step up from most cell-phone and tablet cameras or any 3-5 year old last generation digital camera. The small lens can make shooting some content difficult due to the aperture size-also repeated shooting will drain the batteries (two, A-cell are required) rapidly (as short as one hour of continuous shooting), if set to the 16mp resolution while using the internal flash. Color is well defined and saturated without losing detail.Note: The power requirement became apparent after exhausting the supplied batteries within several hours while taking still-shots in normal room lighting and dark scene (no lighting except as supplied by the subject matter-led custom computer chassis lighting). A quality set of alkaline were subsequently installed and may provide additional continuous shooting time, for example when recording video shots.  It offers vastly better picture quality when compared to the Toshiba Camillo it replaces.It may be prudent to keep an extra pair on hand or just use rechargeable cells and a backup set of alkaline batteries for extended picture taking or video capture.

Reviews.Title: Just as expected
Reviews.Author: Travel LAB
Reviews.Content: I like it just fine. The screen is small, but I love having the viewfinder.  The pictures seem good quality. Haven't had a chance to use it much, yet, but it should be a nice camera to take overseas in a few months.  And, I don't worry about losing an expensive piece of equipment if it gets stolen.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: TypinTootsie
Reviews.Content: I love my PowerShot!  I am not a professional photographer, just a grandma who loves photographing my children and grandchildren.  This camera meets and exceeds my expectations because of its ease of use and excellent digital and printed photographs!

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot
Reviews.Author: Maria Kane "grandmother of 6"
Reviews.Content: It was a gift for my daughter in law and she called me and said it was the best little camera she ever had.  She absolutely loved it  especially all the features it had.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: fercho
Reviews.Content: It's very easy to use  and beautyful model i like it, on this holidays is very important carry a camera.....

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Susie
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It has a view finder which is necessary outdoors but hard to find on digital cameras. Manual is very good.  I haven't used the CD yet.  Takes great pictures.  Price is perfect.  I thought I would have to pay much more for what I wanted.  Fits perfectly in my purse.  I am glad I also purchased the camera case.  What a find!!!

Reviews.Title: Canon A1300
Reviews.Author: jarcher360
Reviews.Content: Looked for a small digital camera with a view finder.  None available in local stores including a Military Exchange.  Product arrived on time and proved easy to set up and use.  Impressed with the quality of the pics as well as the camera itself.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Hostetler
Reviews.Content: This time of year as everyone was or is purchasing merchandise as presents, Amazon is asking for ratings. All I can say the person that I gave it as a gift was impressed.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: SB
Reviews.Content: Not quite what I expected.  Is great size and I can take it in my purse and always have a camera, but I am used to a bigger Fuji and compared to that, it isn't very good at taking pictures.  Takes too long for the flash to recharge and causes me to miss many pictures.  Everyone has red eyes even with that feature turned on.

Reviews.Title: good little camera
Reviews.Author: paperboy
Reviews.Content: Easy camera to use, delay of the shutter and flash was as others had said was rather slow.  We just needed another camera after our Kodak's screen went blank.  I personally like the viewfinder over looking at the screen.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: T. Moore "computer junkie"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my daughter for Christmas and it has worked wonderfully.  It is small and compact, but it takes great pictures and with the sd card that I got she has plenty of memory to store her photos.

Reviews.Title: Very Practical
Reviews.Author: Rafael Parrilla
Reviews.Content: I recommend very much this camera it is very practical and easy to use with an excellent price. Thank you

Reviews.Title: sorry...but, not impressed
Reviews.Author: greytdoghome
Reviews.Content: I got this for Christmas and it was meant to replace my A540 that finally gave out on me. I am so incredibly disappointed (sorry, feel bad because my hubby got it for me). The pros on this camera are: its small, it takes AA batteries, and...that's about it. The cons are: its slow to take pictures, its slow to "charge the flash", the pictures are blurry (at best they just aren't crisp), you can't force the flash on (its either off or on auto...sometimes you are in a mid-light situation and need the flash)...I'm sure I can come up with more cons, but I think you get the idea. Save up a little more money and get something else to save yourself the frustration and disappointment.

Reviews.Title: satisfied
Reviews.Author: radhames gerardo orozco
Reviews.Content: satisfied. comfio quality in your desmpeño and versatility will be worthy of your brand, but I can not use it yet because it brought the memory.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Brandi Wyatt
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera when my other one had a lense error.  I needed something in a pinch for pictures at Christmas.  I got a great deal on the price.  I read all the reviews, which is why I did buy it.  It is a lot smaller than my other camera, but works great.  I don't like how the flash has to charge.  It is also delayed on taking pictures, which I don't like because my kids do not sit still long enough for it to take a good picture of them.  It has other cool features.  It takes black and white photos.  That is a great feature!  I guess that I am just used to my old camera.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Image Quality
Reviews.Author: Clayton Jones
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I've had excellent luck with Canon cameras in the past and I wanted a small camera with a viewfinder.  Everything about this camera is very nice except for the image quality.  It is  truly horrendous and I returned the camera.  The problem is the files are so heavily processed and compressed that all the fine detail is mushed out and filled with artifacts.  The resulting files are smaller and of poorer quality than those from a 6-year-old 7 mpx camera it was meant to replace.  So the 16 mpx resolution is useless.  I've seen cheaper cameras that do a better job.  Canon should be ashamed to put their name on this.  I don't "hate" the camera, which is the label Amazon gives to a 1-star rating, but 1 star is all I can give it.  Don't waste your money on this.

Reviews.Title: small and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Rita
Reviews.Content: we were very satisfied with this camera.  easy to use and talked very good photos.  would recommended it to to others

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: Tom Romanski
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the priceRated 4 stars as I found the menue difficult to follow and there are is not enough explanation of what each function is and what it does in the booklet. This may be covered in more detail on the CD have not had a chance to look at it yet.Took good pictures in auto (where the camera sets everythign up) right out of the box.Would recommend making sure you carry some extra alkaline AA battteries with you as mine were used up fairly quickly and I did not have spares alongOverall  a great little camera though

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, Great camera
Reviews.Author: Pat O "Pat"
Reviews.Content: Received this as gift.  Replaced a very old camera.  Easy to use, Even by me.  I just like to point and shoot. Beautiful pictures

Reviews.Title: Nice "Carry it with you always" camera
Reviews.Author: BoomerRhonda
Reviews.Content: Great for people who want quality shots and ease of use. I carry mine in my purse. Great for long range shots, too.

Reviews.Title: Returned it already
Reviews.Author: P Jackson
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to find a replacement for my Canon A560 (which is showing signs of wearing out),  and that replacement was even at a very good Cyber Monday price!  Alas, as I tested the camera, just about every second or third photo I took was blurry.  I did photography as a sideline for many years and I know that I have a steady hand.  My A560 always produces clear photos, so the only variance was the A1300. Since I have now gotten to the point where there are active little grandchildren in my life, I often can't re-do a photo if the first one does not turn out well.  So I have returned my A1300 and will hope that my A560 holds up a while longer.  I will also hope that the refunding process goes as well as the purchasing and shipping did.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: joe suitss
Reviews.Content: The camera was delivered much faster than I expected. It is much smaller than I expected.  I have large hands, therefore it is difficult for me to use.  I gave it to a friend as a gift. When I shopped at a brick and mortar store for another camera, I found even the 1/2 price I paid for the Cannon Powershot 1300 ($65.00) was not really that big a savings.  I actually found the same camera at Wal-mart for $5.00 less than I paid at Amazon. Lesson Learned!

Reviews.Title: Not happy.
Reviews.Author: carol j. rastaedt
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon previously & loved it. I thought this would be similar but can't delete just one bad photo  but must delete all.Also it takes onger to get in focus than my other one.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected....
Reviews.Author: Denice Underwood
Reviews.Content: It looks like it takes good pictures but it takes forever to snap another one....and then it says the battery for the flash is recharging after every picture....I miss other picture moments after I take one because it takes so long to be able to snap another one.....I wish I could return it and find something else....

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: xp1942
Reviews.Content: Purchased item on 12/19/2012 and received on 12/22/2012.  Item appeared to have been used.  Batteries were loose in the box and the USB cable was not neatly coiled and tied in its open packaging.  Also, there is no wrist strap included in the box. The camera seemed to function adequately when I inserted the batteries and an SD card.  There were smudges on the display screen when I removed from packaging.  This is not cause for return but disappointing when you expect a new camera.

Reviews.Title: Simple and easy to use
Reviews.Author: M. Smith
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, solid camera.  It takes good pictures and is easy to use but lacks a lot of features if you are looking for one that allows lots of choices to modify your photos.  I was looking for a simple and dependable point and shoot, and it does that just fine.

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: john elkins
Reviews.Content: It's very simple to use.  It's a gift so we haven't seen the pictures yet; but I've tested it by shooting and checking the display.

Reviews.Title: Did not meet expectations
Reviews.Author: MS
Reviews.Content: The camera has some nice features - has a view finder and uses regular batteries.  Unfortunately, the positive features could not offset the one feature that anyone needs in a camera, which is to get clear crisp pictures.  The pictures are blurred and even when pictures are not taken in succession, I often get a busy signal due to the bottleneck created by the camera's buffering.  I bought this as an upgrade to my Sony 6mp camera but the old unit's pictures are superior.  The Canon is going back!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted!
Reviews.Author: richp
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot A 1300 is exactly what I was seeking in a pocket camera! I especially like the view finder! I like the fact that it is ready to shoot very quickly and that it has pretty good battery life.I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: I dont like it,
Reviews.Author: Fina
Reviews.Content: I have a old camera another brand... with only 12 mp, and takes better pictures that this one...Bad quality photos

Reviews.Title: A very good camera
Reviews.Author: Gap
Reviews.Content: It is a light weight camera AA battery operated and I like it. I expected the memory but it was not part of the offer. If you want a camera i will recommend you this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Bault "baultta"
Reviews.Content: Got this Camera for our 30th Anniversary trip to Key West, worked very well great pictures, small and convenient, easy to use!

Reviews.Title: Okay
Reviews.Author: M. Mcewan
Reviews.Content: This camera was a bit of a disappointment. I'd had Cannon Powershot SD 770 IS which I absolutely loved. However, I couldn't replace it without spending a fortune. So, I figured I would upgrade to this model. It didn't work out this way. I fear that the image stabilization doesn't really work and my pictures mostly come out blurry. Much as I hate this, I will end up giving this to a younger person with a steady grip and look for something that has good stabilization.

Reviews.Title: MY CANON  1300 CAMERA
Reviews.Author: KEN
Reviews.Content: I LIKE THE SIZE OF THE SCREEN,AND TO USE REGULAR BATTERYS. EASY TO USE. I ENJOY IT.A GOOD HANDY CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Chantal Baz
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It's easy to operate, the pictures are great, and the batteries last longer than on my last camera.  I only wish the viewfinder were clearer: the picture you see is quite small - but at least there is one, which is unusual.

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera
Reviews.Author: Fortidas
Reviews.Content: I like the camera because it meets my needs. It is as it was described on the advert and I love it for its quality pictures. I recommend it for any person who is looking for quality photos

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and excellent pictures
Reviews.Author: Cristian Garcia "Robbin"
Reviews.Content: I bought it to my parents they liked it because it is very easy to use, very good video quality and you can use normal batteries (you can replace them without having to buy any speical one)

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot Cameras
Reviews.Author: Yvonne Harding
Reviews.Content: I have an earlier version and love it a lot.  Probably won't replace it until it croaks.  But this new model is just right for a relative who isn't too photo-savvy, and needed a solid point-and-shoot.  She loved the size as well, as she was packing for a trip halfway round the world.

Reviews.Title: Greate camera
Reviews.Author: jtrev
Reviews.Content: I usdd this for a trip we took and the ability to use regular AA batteries was crucial. We couldnt wait around for a recharge of batteries. This camera works well with regular batteries. The auto functions deliver quality photos. Just be careful not to get any grit on the lense. In the past some sand got into the lense and jammed the shutter.

Reviews.Title: absolutely the worst
Reviews.Author: kaceygirl
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the worst camera I've ever owned. In the past 13 years, I've owned 5 or 6 digital cameras and worn out all of them. I've made photos all around the world in the best and worst conditions.I bought this camera when my Nikon P5100 vanished.  I read all the reviews and I absolutely wanted the Optical Viewfinder. This camera works really well if your subject is in bright daylight and is all lined up smiling, waiting for the shutter to click. Otherwise it is useless.I've used the IS which actually makes 3 shots and gives you a composite (as I understand it). Again, worthless if your subject is not standing perfectly still. I've used the 'low light' with the same results. It takes FOREVER to 'focus' ...again, imagine your subject standing perfectly still with the painted on smile, waiting and waiting.The ONLY thing I like about this camera is the optical viewfinder and IT only shows about 80% of the scene that will be captured.In summary, I got better photos with my Baby Brownie camera in 1955!!!!RUN away from this camera!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: mutantdustbunny
Reviews.Content: This camera is great, one day I'll understand better how it works. Batteries last a long time, so far. I would have bought a camera with a rechargeable battery if I found one with a view finder

Reviews.Title: Not Happy
Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: Not happy with my purchase.  Ended up sending it back.  Took it to my son's Christmas program & only got 2 pictures before the screen went totally black & before that there was MAJOR delay between the few pictures I did get to take.  I would recommend going ahead & just paying extra to get a really nice camera!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera and at a super buy!
Reviews.Author: QBN
Reviews.Content: Received my Canon yesterday, loaded up a 2meg card (comes with none), followed the simple instructions on how to get it setup (my seven year old grandchild guided me through the simple process), and I have taken photos of just about anything that legally stood in front of me.  The camera is just fantastic.  The 16 megapixels are just full of color and sharpness.  I need to say I bought this Canon on a whim, so to speak.  I've had a Kodak EasyShare for years now and I thought the pictures and the videos I took were OK.  Well, I honestly had no idea what I have been missing until I started using this Canon. I do not know what difficulties other folks have had with it - I read some other reviews saying it is difficult to setup, etc., etc.  I can only say I've had no problems whatsoever with it, setup or otherwise, and I am very happy with it.  I also need to compliment Amazon for their extremely user-fiendly site, their customer-focused service, the prompt delivery which at times beats their own delivery estimates, and, of course, their prices.  By the way, Amazon, we are just delighted with our Kindles!!  You have indeed a very happy customer.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Fernando Florindo
Reviews.Content: All Perfect. Good Quality.Very happy this this product. It sutted fine and its a proper item wich i recomment for all users.

Reviews.Title: good value for the money
Reviews.Author: Careful Shopper "Don"
Reviews.Content: This camera is an excellent value. Its size is great, as is ease of use. Its controls are very intuitive.

Reviews.Title: Thrifty
Reviews.Author: amazon
Reviews.Content: The A1300 Canon is a wonderful product offered by the company. Reasonably priced, quality of Canon, easy to use, and I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Estoy bien conforme
Reviews.Author: Manuel Marte
Reviews.Content: Estoy bien satisfecho con el producto comprado, tiene buena resolucion, y me parece una muy buena camara por el precio pagado.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing
Reviews.Author: David Farrell
Reviews.Content: Flash takes ages to charge. Way too many blurry images. Some very good pictures taken which makes the blurry ones even more frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Nice, Small Camera
Reviews.Author: Christine Olsen
Reviews.Content: Needed just a basic camera and this fits the requirement.  Looks nice and modern, and is small enough to fit a woman's hands.  Have used it several times and the pictures are clear and easy to upload to my computer.  Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: David Barkmeier
Reviews.Content: We have had two early models of this camera.  We love them. They are the only camera on the market except for the large Digital SLR camera's that offer a view finder, necessary when shooting in bright sunlight.

Reviews.Title: Gift for my wife
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: She loves it. She like the combination of range finder and screen. Picture quality is fine. We chose it because it was a smaller, lighter camera which still used standard AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for a great price!
Reviews.Author: Razia "Zoey Schmoey"
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a good camera that is reliable and does the job, then this is the one for you! If not, then you need to upgrade to the higher end cameras (Canon EOS Rebel, etc), as I don't think it is a good idea to shop any where between that range. Either take the cheap one that works, has great quality (with the right settings), and does the job; if you don't like that then I suggest you make an investment and buy the expensive professional camera ones as those always tend to meet even the pickiest people's needs.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Ed C
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  I really like the view finder, I use it instead of the screen most of the time because sometimes it's very difficult to see the screen when outside.  It also uses two AA batteries instead of special batteries which is real nice.

Reviews.Title: Bought espescially for view finder
Reviews.Author: John R. Kalenak
Reviews.Content: Canon has very good cameras ,so I felt comfortable buying it . I have been using the camera for 2 weeks and very satisfied with .

Reviews.Title: I like a camera with a view finder as well as a screen
Reviews.Author: Ginger K Comstock
Reviews.Content: I am still getting used to the different settings on this new camera, which are a bit different from my previous Canon camera.  But the pictures it takes are just great.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, low battery life
Reviews.Author: Ursula
Reviews.Content: The camera is great, with so many settings, it really gives you some diversity for what you want your end product to be. However, the flash on the camera is so strong that it will sap the battery in a very short time. I used brand new batteries and went to m parent's house for Thanksgiving, by the end of the night the batteries were dead. Overall tho, its a good camera, I can use it for what I need, and if you can settle for having to buy a large pack of batteries, you are good to go !

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: coco
Reviews.Content: i have never owned one and when i seen this i fell in love with it . it takes great pictures and very easy to use . and the zoom is great over all it is a great camera i would say get this one it has a great price

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot A1300
Reviews.Author: Tim Murphy "TMM"
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with this compact camera (and the software that came bundled). I spent just under $100 and it has alot of features I wanted (including video) without busting the budget. Great value.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Joseph Marino
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price. Easy to use and fine, quality pictures and high quality high-definition videos. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: What a marvel
Reviews.Author: Frank Belavy
Reviews.Content: Made in CHINA!,but very light, and super deal, what can one expect fro the price? I hope it proves reliabel.

Reviews.Title: Mini fingers required
Reviews.Author: NYCRR "NYCRR"
Reviews.Content: DISPLAY SCREEN: small, described as 3" but looks smaller as compared to a Sony;BATTERY COMPARTMENT: uses 2 AA batteries (good thing), the SD card goes next the batteries; bad thing: the compartment door is very hard to close;CONTROLS: The buttons are very small you need very small fingers or a stylus.

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: lbaize3
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my wife who is the most non-technical person I know. She takes pictures and videos with ease and even downloads the images to her laptop computer. I especially like the ability to use an optical viewfinder that does not wash out in bright sun light.

Reviews.Title: is an ecxelent camera for this price
Reviews.Author: david gomez
Reviews.Content: nice pics and fuctions, is really eassy to take good photos. the problem is that the baterries end really fast

Reviews.Title: Great camera, good quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Werner
Reviews.Content: This camera replaced another that had a screen only. Most often, in sunlight and on beaches, the screen reflected. Thanks to Amazon, I found a small, reasonable camera with a screen and a viewer. Normal batteries available everywhere is another plus.Vacation pictures are simply great, equal to the ones taken with my Canon EOS. What is missing on this small pocket camera, is a feature to by-pass the automatic flash. Often, you have people in the front and sunlight in the back. Using the automatic feature, they end-up as dark silhouettes. With a flash on demand like on my EOS, the faces would show.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: A. Gallert
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my husband and he likes it.I liked it so much that when I found it at half price ata local store, my husband bought it for me as aChristmas gift!

Reviews.Title: POWER SHOT A1300 REVIEW
Reviews.Author: Madison P. McClintic
Reviews.Content: I bought the A1300 primarily because it included a viewfinder which is now very hard to find. I have taken more that 500 shots so far and am quite pleased with the results. (recent trip to France). I find that I use the screen on the reverse most of the time, but there are times in certain light conditions that the viewfinder is most helpful. The 16.0 MP allows me to take low light shots without flash in most instances. There are times in low light situations that focusing is difficult. I am generally quite pleased with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1300 Review
Reviews.Author: Rod Paine
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace my trusty Canon S230, a very compact and sturdy pocketable carry camera. The Canon A1300 gives me a wider angle lens; higher resolution; use of standard 'AA' type batteries; an all important optical viewfinder (as my S230 had) to deal with very brite picture locations which pretty much wash out LCD images; a camera actually smaller and lighter than my old S230 and a very low cost. I recently took about 600 photos in Europe and the results were very good. My only complaint is that my large hands often hit a button on the camera that was not intended, so I have to pay more attention. It's a great carry camera at a great price, in my experience.-Rod

Reviews.Title: For the money, it's great!  Simple, easy to learn the features, came with a great Users Guide too.
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: Simple, easy to learn the features, came with a great Users Guide too. Can easily be used before even reading the Customers Guide.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: k.r.
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera now for about a month and used it extensively in the garden and traveling.  The pictures are crisp and clear and the amount of functions are amazing for this price range.  It took a while to get used to the function dial, but I really like being able to toggle between auto and specfic functions like 'vivid'. The view finder is a little off but I'm so glad to have it as an option to the screen. It was really hard finding a camera in this price range with a real view finder.  Thankful to come across this camera. Totally enjoying it and the batteries last well when not in movie mode.

Reviews.Title: love the viewfinder
Reviews.Author: txkylady
Reviews.Content: Good buy for the money - great to have a viewfinder -- just wish it were heavier.  Quite uUser friendly.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Price
Reviews.Author: morrie johnson
Reviews.Content: The price was outstanding and it takes great pictures. Walmart sells this camera for $99.00 and I bought this one for $74 and change.

Reviews.Title: has everything I needed.
Reviews.Author: sgista
Reviews.Content: The main reason I choose this camera was because it has a viewfinder that keeps up with the lcd display. Some digital cameras have a viewfinder but it is not accurate. I also purchased this camera as it appears that it is easy to use for people who do not see well up close and are not comfortable with a lot of technology. I have found that this camera is a little more complicated to use than it is portrayed. If you are willing to spend a little time getting to know your camera and going through the owner's manual you will find it does absolutely amazing pictures for its rather small and light size. I honestly thought from the picture it would be a little larger that it is. Upon reviewing the manual I was able to take some nice pictures. I am excited to take this camera with me on vacation to the caribbean next month. I bought this camera to replace one that was destroyed on our European trip this summer and were forced to take our photos with our cell phones.

Reviews.Title: My LOVED camera
Reviews.Author: Patricia
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect anything from this camera. I have a Canon EOS Digital and I love it, but I needed a pocket camera point and shoot.  I have run through many and continue to have a full drawer of older ones.  So I was desperate and ordered this one against my better judgement and lo!, my better judgement was wrong. Unlike other point and shoots that I have, the colors are true, there are a million options that make you able to do things that I only think of for SLR's, and the pictures are so true to color, crispness and fastness.  This is an amazing camera.  Also, it takes two AA batteries, and I thought that would be horrible.  NO.  The batteries last and last, you can use rechargeable ones, and click click just take and take.  I think this cute tiny camera has to be the best for your price.  If you are a professional, obviously not, but for most of us.  even African faces are perfect. (except if it is dark and you have to count on the flash, but nothing works then.)

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Leroy G. Wilson "TheFonz"
Reviews.Content: I was shopping for a small, easy to use camera to replace my old first generation digital. The Canon has the features I was looking for in a small pocket size. The replaceable AA batteries makes this camera exactly what I needed. The price was good also. Completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Cheryl
Reviews.Content: I like having the view finder on the camera. Take great pictures inside and outside. It is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power shot A1300
Reviews.Author: Denise D. Snyder "mamie94"
Reviews.Content: All I can say is we love this camera. It is compact and takes terrific pictures !!! I am not a great photographer but my husband is very good with a camera and he is very satisfied with it. If you are looking for a reasonably priced camera with a great zoom, and easy to use, this is it !!!!!

Reviews.Title: canon power shot camera
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Kandy K. Wagoner "kaywag"
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this camera for my purposes.  Small easy to hanlde, easy to operate, takes regular batteries.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Helga Crosby
Reviews.Content: I am quite pleased with this camera. I had the older model before it and it continues to be a good point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: To Each His Own
Reviews.Author: jaynic
Reviews.Content: This is by no means a professional camera, BUT, for us simple minded point & shoot folks, its fantastic...Easy to use and GREAT PICS, even in dim light without the flash...Very Happy with the Camera & the Price!!!

Reviews.Title: good product for the price.
Reviews.Author: T. Win
Reviews.Content: good product for the price. Cannon never failed on the cameras. This is the regular battery model since I need to be able to replace the battery at the job site.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!!!
Reviews.Author: DCali
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  The quality of this camera is really good and it's easy to use. We have a new family member and we are using it alot. Taking pictures almost everyday.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: James Sieminski
Reviews.Content: met all my expectations.  great camera. great price. great pictures!!!!! very easy to use. the help button on the camera is a life saver.

Reviews.Title: canon camera
Reviews.Author: Gayle
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter in law and sheloves it.  she's been taking alot of pictures and whatshe's shown me look beautiful.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Mom
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera....purchased for my son.....he loves taking pictures and sharing them with otherssince he is unable to speak......he tells his stories with his pictures.  Works great!

Reviews.Title: Cannon Powershot A1300
Reviews.Author: John Cockerel
Reviews.Content: The camera does everything I want. I am somewhat disappointed with the black and white photos which were grainy. Also the camera ran through four sets of batteries in six days. The flash does take a while to recharge so quick shots requiring flash are not possible. Overall I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Diane A. Breaux "DAFD1"
Reviews.Content: I'm not too familiar with the various choices in cameras but this camera totally served its purpose!I bought it for my son's wedding and it took some great pics!Love it and glad I chose this camera!

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Ronald L. Esarey
Reviews.Content: I have a cannon PowerShot A590,and this A1300 is real nice lots of improvements.Small lighter,takes HD video,more zoom.A whole nice OSD that can put the date and timed on the pictures,the small video I shot was so easy and looked great.Save your self about 25.00 by getting the sliver version,for the black A1300 doesn't offer any more options,it is one and the same!The book is on a dvd and is 184 pages,I'm sure there is much more to this,highly recommend this camera,got the case and a 16 bit chip for 95.00 free ship!

Reviews.Title: functions great, body scratches easily
Reviews.Author: tjgust
Reviews.Content: I have been using an older Canon Powershot as my concealable camera (D550)and wished to upgrade to a higher pixel count and smaller size. I was overjoyed that I was finally able to find this camera that had an optical viewfinder, since this is a priority for me. It functions well, although it seems a little slow to focus and take the picture. The slightly greater zoom range is also nice, as is the AA battery capability.I was surprised and upset that the silver case scratched badly the first time I used the camera; apparently the silver paint is not very durable.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Product was received in excellent condition and is working great.  I really like the extra viewfinder for the times when the screen just will not show a good image.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1300 16.o mp Digital Camera with 5x Digital Image stabilzed zoom 28mm wide-Angle Lens with 72op HD Video Record
Reviews.Author: GSGosn10
Reviews.Content: I like my new camara, it's what I was looking for, it was in real good shape when I recived it, thank you GSG

Reviews.Title: Compact Professional
Reviews.Author: Howard Dean
Reviews.Content: I own a Nikon DX, in comparison to the Canon PowerShort A1300. The A1300 proforms the same fuctions professional, a very good compact camera.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot
Reviews.Author: Frank Zaccaria
Reviews.Content: Greeat and easy to use. love the auto focus and the price is right. with the 16 MP pictures are super sharp and print out equal in quality of a studio print. Really!

Reviews.Title: happy
Reviews.Author: Norma Nunamaker
Reviews.Content: I got my husband the canon A1300 powershot camera for our anniversary and he is very pleased with it.  It is easy to handle.  He had a problem with lettering coming off but got ahold of Canon and they replaced it with a new camera with no problem at all.  We are pleased with Canons response to the situation. He is still learning the different functions but enjoying taking his own pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures, Not So Great Videos!
Reviews.Author: Kawa Jaan "THE GAMER"
Reviews.Content: This very compact Canon PowerShot is capable of taking very good pictures but it's 5x zoom is just not that great for video recording. The zoom feature, when used in video recording, distorts the film and is actually unusable. However, this is still a great, compact camera that takes really good pictures, with many features and options, and is compact and easy to use. The camera fits easily in ones pocket and the large, easy-to-use buttons make it easy to take pictures. I just wish it could be better at recording videos.

Reviews.Title: Quick service- love the camera
Reviews.Author: C. Moore
Reviews.Content: I had two cameras, old Nikon and a newer Fuji fine pix. Both were on their way out and I needed an inexpensive replacement for a trip.I take gravestone photos. At least 100 a week.Browsed the choices. Asked in another forum what was best in 100 dollar range and the Canon 1300 was the most popular answer. So I ordered it  and it showed up in less than a week.I am happy with it- responds quickly to a click and the photos are fine for my non professional casual style.Trip was cancelled but I still take pix locally. It is great therapy for me.

Reviews.Title: Cavon PowerShot A1300 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: scootchn
Reviews.Content: Very resonable price considering the 16.0 megapixels and 5X zoom. Even more appreciated was the optical viewfinder. Compact size and ease of use are a bonus.

Reviews.Title: Good Point Shoot and Good Value
Reviews.Author: H. Knapp
Reviews.Content: Excellent value in a point and shoot camera.  Takes excellent pictures.  Easy to operate.  Excellent price.  After several weeks and a few dozen pictures we have found all the controls except how to control the file size, a very minor problem, if it is a problem at all.  Battery life seems to be very good.  We are amateurs and very satisfied with this unit both in quality and in price.  Definitely would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1300IS 16.0 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: LesW
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my friend who is a novice.  He loves it, and I think it is an excellent camera for the price. Point and shoot was the main reason for buying.  Love the viewfinder.  Delivery and packaging from Amazon very good.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera review
Reviews.Author: Grumpy
Reviews.Content: This is a great little compact Canon canon. It has 16mp, 5X zoom, viewfinder as well as live screen view, all at a great price. It is small enough to fit in my pants or shirt pocket so I don't have to lug around my big DSLR at parties or dinners, but still gives great resolution for 4 x 6 photos.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: boe "Pam"
Reviews.Content: Love the camera, takes great pictures, easy to use. I am going to the Grand Canyon in Sept and taking this camera with me, I should get some fantastic photos with it.

Reviews.Title: Descripcion de la Camara
Reviews.Author: maria
Reviews.Content: Adquiri una carama digital, de este tipo de marca y mega pixel,, y la verdad no es lo que esperaba, al encender la camara la pantalla se ve como si tubiera arenilla, y se ve espantoso, deberia ser evaluada una camara u artefacto antes de ser enviado a un cliente para ganar reputacion, de verdad esta camara no cumple con las espectativas como la dibujan, el zoom es algo feo, sin palabras, disculpen la onestidad, pero por lo que se pago y mas por el envio hacia mi pais que es venezuela no estoy conforme,,,....

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot camera with viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Bowman
Reviews.Content: This camera is a significant improvement over the Canon A560 that it replaced (which we liked very much until its untimely end).  It is smaller, lighter with more zoom capability and more megapixels.  It was also less expensive.  We would recommend it without reservations.

Reviews.Title: Too many buttons
Reviews.Author: D. Osborne
Reviews.Content: We've had a Canon camera for decades, from SLR to G1 to A700 they have all been excellent products and every one has performed as advertised and never had a defect.  As technology advanced, each device had its own learning curve.  The A1300 generation went from buttons and dials to just buttons, so now instead of a glance and thumb to change modes, a dance through buttons and menus is needed.  It is harder to use then previous, but does take excellent pictures with good automation if you want it.  Confusing the shutter and power buttons is very easy.The Canon picture transfer program is also a step backward, it is not compatible to older cameras and doesn't work across network shares, so load it separately from older programs.  No major improvements from previous programs.The camera uses AA batteries, which is good because of availability far and wide.  No matter how good a rechargeable is, when its dead, its hours away from being usable again.  You can't judge battery usage by picture count, figure on 45 minutes to an hour of continuous use or 2 to 3 sets a day during ambitious site seeing.All in all, if you are looking for a good grab and snap pocket/purse camera, the A1300 is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera but one or two querks
Reviews.Author: Jak
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice camera ans well worth the price. Though I was kinda disappointed that it takes batteries and they die very fast if using the camera a lot. Also frustrating that with the flash off i get nothing but blury shots unless i am 100% still. Other then the little bothers though, amazing.

Reviews.Title: labeled as new, was used
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter. Saved it for a gift that I just gave her. I was very disappointed to have her show me that there were photos on the camera. I am a huge Amazon fan but this purchase leaves me frustrated. It's a great camera, though. Just really want to know that when I pay for a new product, I'm getting a new one. Please be careful, Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality was terrible
Reviews.Author: Desert Walker
Reviews.Content: I hope this was just a bad camera.  After owning 5 Canon Power Shot cameras I wanted to upgrade fromn 8 meg, 4X optical zoom to a 16 meg 5X opt..  This camera was exactly what I wanted. it uses AA batteries and had an optical view finder, options that are getting harder to find.  Received camera new in box, excellent shape.  Took a series of pictues in the house using several scene settings and the pictures were very substandard.  My Son started taking pictures with my old camera and I took same using the new camera.  Inside, outside, macro, low light, every varible we could think of and this camera did not perform as well as my old camera under any of these conditions.  I did not have time to order another, taking a chance on same results.  Ended up buying a competitors camera locally.The seller accepted my return with out hesitation and instantly refunded the purchase amount without charging return shipping.  The Seller gets 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Save your Money!DON'T BUY!
Reviews.Author: JOSHMO
Reviews.Content: Save your money. Takes Forever to take pictures once you focus it! Takes Forever to recycle the flash! Pictures seem MUCH TOO grainy to me(too many Megapixels). Should have listened to the others reviews here! DON'T DON'T BUY!!!! Spend a few more bucks and get a better Disposable Point and Shoot Than This!

Reviews.Title: canon file system sucks, pix are so so
Reviews.Author: Remigius Hohl
Reviews.Content: I hate that I can't just plug the camera into my laptop and copy the pictures as files, I gotta use the stupid, slow canon software, and it does it's thing, creating folders for every day... stupid, takes more time, more work!My card reader can't read the format!Then the pix are sometimes ok, soemtimes just plain bad, the viewfinder is so so..The camera does not take sharp pictures! The colors are off!I previously had a Panasonic Lumix that was great, but after 2 years its monitor died, and they dont make AA cameras anymore, which is tragic, so now I got this lousy Canon and life is not a joyful as it once was.I wonder if the Nikon AA battery camera would have been better?

Reviews.Title: Too many bells and whistles
Reviews.Author: Lovin it
Reviews.Content: I love the camera and will like it better once I learn about all the features it offers.  I do wish it had come with a case and I had to buy a separate memory disc, but other than that it takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Wow!  What a camera!!
Reviews.Author: cup of tea
Reviews.Content: Got the Canon PowerShot A1300 as a gift for my daughter.  She Loves, Loves, Loves it.  Pretty powerful for a little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: M. Manjoney
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, I got it to replace a camera my kids poured Sprite on.  This was in my price range and the quality is phenomenal.The only con I have with the camera is there is no stabilizer, so if your hands are shaky, the pictures may or may not come out blurry.  I haven't played around with the settings too much yet so there may be a way to cut down on the blur.For the price it is a beautiful camera that takes crisp clear images.  The zoom is amazing as well!

Reviews.Title: So-So
Reviews.Author: Troy Meffert
Reviews.Content: This is my first low end cannon camera and I feel the performance is only so-so. I got a great deal on it so I really can't complain about price. I guess I just expected more given my past experience with the more high end cannon equipment.

Reviews.Title: never been so disatisfied with a product off amazon, and I have been a long time buyer. I purchase a lot of items off this websi
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: Camera lenses is broken, makes a weird noise when it gets to turn on. Very dissatisfied with this product. Packaging was not proper. Batteries were loosely tossed in box. Camera lense is scratched and the picture is very blurry. Only good is it came a day early.

Reviews.Title: A constant headache and source of dissapointment.
Reviews.Author: Arock
Reviews.Content: Not a camera guy, but I will say this: I had cameras 8 years ago that took better pictures at half the cost of this one. don't know what the deal is, but this thing just doesn't take good pics for me. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: It was amazing...when it worked!
Reviews.Author: Daylin Pujol -lopez "dp"
Reviews.Content: When I bought this as a gift for my mom a couple of months ago she was ecstatic! It was small, powerful and simple to use. She's no pro photographer, and uses it for family photos, trips, etc.  However, recently she complained that the camera will not focus and has started taking blurry, dark pictures even when the shutter is held halfway. We tried resetting it, but many amazing pictures have been ruined because they are indistinguishable. The only solution we have found is turning it off, and then restarting which sometimes works, but sometimes it must be turned off 4 or 5 times until it focuses at all!  The flash takes a minute or longer to "charge" as well, which combined with the not focusing issue makes it impossible to use the Canon Powershot A1300. I most definitely do NOT recommend this product due to it's instability.

Reviews.Title: battery cover constantly pops open
Reviews.Author: Paul Oliver
Reviews.Content: and it takes forever to charge the flash.  Would not recommend this product.  I am just a mom who wants to take a quick pic here and there, but instead I am always picking my batteries off the floor or waiting a long time to capture a moment that has long passed.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and useless toy
Reviews.Author: Lilikoi
Reviews.Content: A very basic camera with less than basic features. I bought this camera, hoping to replace my older Canon, which I loved. Auto setting makes pictures come out way too dark and often grainy. Digital IS seems to be a joke, as every little shake and move is visible. Zooming takes forever to adjust and doesn't seem to work at all on close objects like flowers. Flash takes forever to recharge. Also colors and shadings are way off. Does not include a very useful instruction manual, so you sort of have to figure out the settings by yourself - even though any settings on this camera won't change it's poor quality. All in all a disappointment. I thought Canon could have done better on a basic camera.No, I would not recommend this product to anybody.Update 10/4/13: Oh yes: The lens won't open ("lens error" on screen) all the sudden, even though I didn't drop the camera or misused it in any way. This happened 10 months after purchasing.

Reviews.Title: Initial surprise  HEADS UP
Reviews.Author: Philip Fitzpatrick "Fitzlark"
Reviews.Content: Heads up:  My camera did NOT come with a memory card.  The guide indicates that this is usual for this camera. I consider this a nasty surprise.More later - after I can actually use the camera.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: sillyyilly
Reviews.Content: Great camera in my opinion. Tested it out great quality, took a lot of pictures, and it came out great. Easy to use. Only thing I didn't like was the double a battery use other than that its worth it.

Reviews.Title: low quality
Reviews.Author: Maritza
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for quality look somewhere else. My old sony cybershot 14.1 megapixel camera takes better pictures and videos than this junk. But I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: hard to figure out
Reviews.Author: dawnallwoodboop
Reviews.Content: they said point and shoot. well that's not quite right. don't forget you need  a card first,and I guess you have to sit w/ the book & bring out your local geek squad to help.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1300
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Camera works fine, takes good pictures.  Thought it had internal memory and an optional add for SD memory, like my other one, to discover it does not.  It requires a SD memory card.  Probably would not have boughten had I know that.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Webber77
Reviews.Content: Camera was beautiful and package contained al the parts for a Christmas morning  present opening  except for one thing.  Camera did not include a memory card.  If I had known I would have purchased one before wrapping this present.Canon needs to know this spoiled a gift for on the moment to use itbut camera is top notch in every way

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Teresa Wise
Reviews.Content: It is very easy to use & small enough to fit in your pocket to keep handy for great pictures.

Reviews.Title: I did not like the camera... It was smaller than I had thought and I did not like the feel of it in my hand for picture taking.
Reviews.Author: ga1boss
Reviews.Content: Did not like the cameraDid not like the feel of the camera in my haveFar too small for me

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1300
Reviews.Author: Rhino
Reviews.Content: Camera came but not image.  Going to cost me over $5.00 to return a piece of junk.  That just doesn't seem fair.

Reviews.Title: Bad buy
Reviews.Author: NancyB
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in Sept. for my husband for his birthday and it has already broke and its only Nov. This camera is a waste of money. He did not like it from day one, I should have returned it.

Reviews.Title: Try it and see it for yourself...
Reviews.Author: Mikel
Reviews.Content: Try it and see it for yourself. To me, this one is nice though seem light weight and cheap in material (not sure but Canon does). So far, I love it and still using it from time to time. I hope this will last.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: perri
Reviews.Content: Product was shipped quickly.  I ordered two cameras for my office. Cameras are being used for contract work taking pictures of projects.  They are small so can be tucked into any carryall.  They work Great!!!

Reviews.Title: A1300 or A1300IS
Reviews.Author: D. Punch
Reviews.Content: I ordered a 1300IS but what was shipped was in a box that said A1300. Writing on the camera says A1300.  Am I missing something here?
