I didn't see anything in the manual (Adobe reader) about IS . I went to Canons web site and did a search for the A1300IS and what comes up is the A1300. Are these two model numbers one and the same?  Just asking.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: stuckinlodiagain
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  Very easy to use.  Takes great pictures, and I especially like having a viewfinder in addition to the LCD screen.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: I have bought the A1300 camera about a month ago from Amazon.It works fine. I have no problems so far.I like the viewfinder. But I hadn't have time to check all everything in depth.

Reviews.Title: No what I expected
Reviews.Author: Drbot
Reviews.Content: This camera did not meet my expectations.  It looks like a cheap reusable kids camera.  Even though it was priced low I was hoping it would be of reasonable quality.  In the end I had to return it and get the PowerShot A4000IS.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: JKM
Reviews.Content: i love this camera  but wish the instruction booklet was more detailed. I am not a good person with gadgets and it took me a while to figure out all the different settings. it didn't help that i decided at the last minute to order and got it the day before i left on vacation so i didn't have alot of time to mess around with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camers, Amazon's ordering policy is POOR
Reviews.Author: PUD
Reviews.Content: Having used a Canon PowerShot 710IS for year, I decided to look at Canon when we decided to replace our Line crew cameras.  The PowerShot A1300 still has a view finds (great for use in the sun) and still uses AA batteries (Great for being out in the field).Though I haven't used the camera long, it feels well-built and takes great pictures.  Sure, they are nothing like my EOS 7a with an L-lens, but for a point and shoot, it great.Amazon ordering policy really sucks!  I needed 10 cameras and decided to order the bundle, camera, case and 16 GB card.  Added them to my cart, logged on, chose my shipping address, pushed continue and the next page, Amazon decided to inform me I can only order one camera and 3 cases though they would let me order 10 cards.  WTF!!!!!  Item page said nothing about an order limit!!!I call amazon and the CSR, who was great, indicated there was an order limit and that I would have to order one set every 7 days!  Hum, so they can raise the price???  Yes as I had them in my cart since yesterday and the price went up $10 overnight!!!  I asked the CSR they wanted me to take 70 days to order the equipment we needed???  What a poor way to operate.  So, I went to CDWG, ordered everything I needed, though the camera was $5 more each and they will be here by the end of the week (free shipping too!!).Nice bait and switch Amazon.  You will be the last place I look for something in the future!!!

Reviews.Title: It has a mind of its own
Reviews.Author: Mary Lou Burke
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading lots of reviews. I was not happy with it. If all you want is a point and shoot, pictures of people, general scenery, etc., it does fine. But I had trouble with it for close-ups. I tried to take a close-up of a butterfly chrysalis, and the camera took BEAUTIFUL photos of leeks in the back of my garden. The chrysalis was all blurry. It's like the camera has a mind of its own. I just could not convince it to use its macro mode.I bought a Kodak EasyShare at a Closeout store for half the price. It's bigger, but so far I like it better. It functions as a point and shoot, but there are scene buttons so you can override the controls. This gives the camera more versatility, in my opinion. The Cannon would be a great camera for a kid if it weren't more expensive than the Kodak.

Reviews.Title: inaccurate spec
Reviews.Author: rastaman "reggae ambassador"
Reviews.Content: This camera does not have a 28mm lens, as you can see from the image. It is 25mm. I don't now how much of a defect that will prove to be. I hope it doesn't mean much, but I missed that.

Reviews.Title: So Far Pretty Good
Reviews.Author: Joanne L...
Reviews.Content: The camera seems to work pretty good for the price.  What is irritating is that the batteries that came with the camera did not last more that 20 pictures.  Also, the instruction manual is on a disk.  That's fine for people that have a computer, not so good for people that do not.  Having to wing my way figuring out the camera.  Have not tried the video yet.

Reviews.Title: Not Good
Reviews.Author: T. J. Irvine
Reviews.Content: Horrible, grainy, fuzzy, low resolution picture quality. Camera phones(at least the iPhone) honestly blow it away. Cheap, flimsy plastic build that is destined to break, especially the battery door. Maybe mine is defective but I made the mistake of buying it at Newegg when they had a sale for 90 dollars and I can't even exchange it for a different model(never buying from Newegg again). I don't trust trying another one of these cameras but I will RMA for a replacement and try to sell this disgrace of a camera unopened.Good marketing hype by Canon to fool me into thinking this would be a decent camera even at the low price. I was looking for a replacement for a 5 year old Kodak that died which took good quality pictures for the $199 we originally paid. Was hoping this could about equal that camera but I was sure off on that by a million miles.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: George Chalustowski
Reviews.Content: I have not used the camera because I do not have a power charger that should have come with the unit.  The directions also are very confusing so it discouraged me from taking the time to figure out how to operate the camera.  I had wanted to use the camera on my last trip, and when I finally did study the directions, I realized, too late, that I needed the charger.  It made no sense to use it on a trip if one had any chance of losing any of the photos.  Instead, I relied on my old camera, which works perfectly.  In future sales, it should be clear one needs a power charger so the camera will stay operational.

Reviews.Title: Poor performance
Reviews.Author: Susan Couillard
Reviews.Content: Discription did not mention that it used reg AA batteries which continuously lose strength.  Picture quality is poor.  Long delay after taking picture so many pictures are ruined due to movement.  Unfortunately I will have to buy another one and it won't be a Canon Power shot.

Reviews.Title: Barely Acceptable Pictures
Reviews.Author: handyman315
Reviews.Content: Product arrived in good condition and is exactly as advertised.  Reasonably priced.The resulting pictures are barely acceptable.  Do not even think about taking pictures in low or reduced light; the results are grainy and out of focus.  Using flash is little better, with overexposed and underexposed areas on the same picture.Use this camera for outdoor snapshots, and something better for for your prized shots.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Camera
Reviews.Author: Mark Simpson
Reviews.Content: Takes too long in between shots, auto focus is terrible. Do not buy. My cheap Nicon was much better. This camera is a bad purchase.

Reviews.Title: wanted a viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Janet Williams
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small camera with a viewfinder that I could stick in my pocket to take to Disney World. The viewfinder is very small, but the camera does take nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot Camera A1300IS
Reviews.Author: mg
Reviews.Content: I have not used this but 3 times to take a photo of my cat.  I like it very much so far.  It is smaller than my previous camera and I like it much better.  I lost my previous camera last year.  It was a Canon IS530 I think.  I was attracted to the features and the size of this one.

Reviews.Title: Great beginner camera, simple to use
Reviews.Author: Wayne's Reviews
Reviews.Content: Simple to use, great for beginners, has alot of shooting options that are very easy to use and access. I bought this for my wife for her birthday which is in September and I am having a blast using it, until I give it to her on her birthday!I would definitley recommend this camera to anyone wanting a basic camera with alot of very useful shooting options.Thank you Canon for such a nice and simple camera that takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: good camera for good money
Reviews.Author: Bbasso
Reviews.Content: A small camera that takes big pictures. Good camera for good money.I'd recommend this Canon for anyone who need to take good pictures for not a lot of money.Update:Still works like when I bought it. Glad I did.

Reviews.Title: No pocket size instruction booklet
Reviews.Author: Marie
Reviews.Content: Canon does not include an instruction book, or a Getting Started manual, only a cd, which doesn't help when one is away from the computer.  They say it can be put on one's phone, but that will take more than twice as long to find the appropriate section and then is much harder to read on portable equipment.  Most people who have cameras want an instruction book to put in their camera bag so that they can refer to it.  This is not at all customer friendly and I will never buy Canon again.

Reviews.Title: Not so great
Reviews.Author: charlotte
Reviews.Content: The photos from this little camera are great, but its battery usage is crazy! It can capture only about 10 pictures and then the batteries need to be replaced. Since there is not a rechargeable battery, this is a pain--especially for travel. I would suggest spending more and getting a camera with a rechargeable battery. I plan to return this camera.

Reviews.Title: Not good value
Reviews.Author: Spokane WA
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and upon reading some reviews I have the same issue. View finder went black, batteries are lasting less than a day, flash takes soooooooo long to re charge. Then to top it all at a 31 year reunion, a very special deal for me the pictures all vanished. I do know how to delete and I did not. One minute they were there and the next gone. I had to try and duplicate some of the shots however lost a lot of precious memories.I can not ge the board to function in my computer. Tells me the file name too long! What is this.I have some pictures in the camera I will take to Wal mart and have developed then this camera is getting thrown off the highest cliff I can find.Waste of money!

Reviews.Title: review of a1300
Reviews.Author: Rene J. Boufford
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I was so impressed with the A1200 with it's energy savings that it uses. This is a good camera but not as good as the a1200.

Reviews.Title: The camera is OK ...terrible delivery!
Reviews.Author: splob
Reviews.Content: I needed this camera for a hiking trip and it was a last minute purchase; 1 day shipping. I was in my front yard when I heard a thud! the delivery guy tossed it over our 6' foot gate! the corner of the box was mashed.The packaging was a couple air pillows and the OM packaging wedged against one side of the amazon box. I couldn't believe it. I went out the gate in time to see the delivery guy avoiding me as he sped off.Maybe he was having a bad day but this is unacceptable. I reported it to amazon (7/12) including pics of the mashed box and a description of the driver ...never heard a word back.

Reviews.Title: responce to ebays request.
Reviews.Author: james bradbery
Reviews.Content: after receiving the camera, i noticed the a1300# was missing the is (image stabilazation), icalled ebay rep. & she looked up the spects. on canon for me,& confirmed it did have that feature, as a result of trial on the camera, i was happy with the results & i thank your people for courtesy & help. i haved shopped ebay for awhile & am verry pleased. sincearly james.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: I like the camera.  Have not uploaded yet.Canon PowerShot A1300 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 5x Digital Image Stabilized Zoom 28mm Wide-Angle Lens with 720p HD Video Recording (Silver)

Reviews.Title: Memory Card not included
Reviews.Author: Stan8211
Reviews.Content: We sent this back. First of all, we received the camera and then had to go out and buy a memory card! Then when we got it working, the pictures were not very good. So we sent it back.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot A1300
Reviews.Author: golfjunkie
Reviews.Content: I'm still trying to learn how to use it. Haven't been able to get it to go to email to send photos. Any tips?

Reviews.Title: Snowy images, blurry and cheap
Reviews.Author: Prof Shelby
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed right away - it's cheaply constructed. Has a hollow feeling. Tried it out right away and noticed how "snowy" the photos were. I went through the settings and even changed the size in order to produce a clearer shot, but it's basically a cheap camera. I've always had Canon cameras and this is the first time I've been left terribly disappointed by the results. My last camera was the A460 (only 4X Optical Zoom). I needed a new Canon after that one began taking photos with an orange blur across the pics. My hope was the upgrade to this camera would be great but that's not the case. Returning.

Reviews.Title: Will be returning this camera
Reviews.Author: Sean Hert
Reviews.Content: Really not impressed with this camera in the slightest. The pictures have no depth of field, lots of pixel artifacts, and after the first 50-60 shots, a dark grey cloudy spot appeared just below and to the right of the center. I have cleaned the lens multiple times, this cloudy spot hasn't moved or lightened.I will be returning this camera to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Cellphone camera is better
Reviews.Author: Amazon User "And Loving It"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera thinking it was a good value from a respectable camera company in Canon. I wanted a camera to take on bicycle rides and to take in my pocket around town with me. There were some positive reviews, and the Canon PowerShot A1300 is around 4 stars overall. I'm not quite sure how, though.The pictures this camera takes are very poor quality. I tested it out on a nice day. In good lighting outside (some light clouds, so it was not a harsh lighting situation) and photos were very washed out. The colors are not vibrant at all. I had the camera on the highest quality setting, and from about 20 feet away I took a photo of my car. Under magnification on the computer, the lettering on my license plate was too fuzzy to read. 16MP?I did a final test with this camera. I took the same photo / view outside in good lighting during the day with this camera and with my cell phone (8MP camera on the Samsung Galaxy SII). I asked my family which photo was better -- the cell phone photo won. The colors were better, the contrast was better, the image was clearer; just an overall better photo from the cell phone than from the A1300.The camera is being returned to Amazon. Why carry an extra item, when it does not take very good photos? No where near the quality I would expect based on the product description.

Reviews.Title: Disposable Batteries
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Nilson
Reviews.Content: This is a crappy, plastic piece of junk.  I had no idea it would be this cheap.  I guess I should have read more carefully.  The previous one I had broke down.  I thought I was buying something similar.

Reviews.Title: Catalog page malfunction.
Reviews.Author: LloydStoner
Reviews.Content: The Canon powershot A1300 I received does not have the image stabilization that was shown under "Items Ordered" on the order acknowledgement I received on 8/22/12 8:17 AM.  when I spoke on the telephone with your clerk, she could not find the correct catalog page.I kept trying to get this problem corrected and did so.  Amazon paid attention to my complaint after I took it to Facebook.  Their "callback" procedure is a big improvement over the usual "computer talk" that you get when you make  corporate calls.  It is just hard to find the 'callback' button.

Reviews.Title: terrible camera!
Reviews.Author: sam
Reviews.Content: I have used only canon products for years and never had a problem with them until this camera.  I have a 40D that's wonderful but wanted something smaller to just put in my purse for trips and stuff.  This camera was used twice and the second time the batteries (rechargable, charged and brand new) stopped working.  It kept turning off and losing pics.  I bought new batteries and the same thing happened.  It ruined my vacation this year... no pics except the ones on my cell phone!  I would NOT recommend purchasing this camera and wish I'd looked at a nikon or pretty much anything else.  I had an olympus that was a gift previously that was fine but my dogs chewed it.  Guess I may give that a try again.  But, this camera is terrible and a complete waste of money!

Reviews.Title: to little to late
Reviews.Author: jake59
Reviews.Content: upon using this camera I found it hard use the controlspoor reslutionpoor picture qualityI wish I never bought

Reviews.Title: Not a good camera
Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: This camera doesn't come with rechargeable batteries and it has terrible zoom, takes really blurry pictures and I am overall really disappointed in the camera. I guess you get what you pay for...

Reviews.Title: Not what it seemed
Reviews.Author: luckydog
Reviews.Content: I really wanted a camera with a view finder, it had one of those alright, but so tiny and when putting in the batteries I felt it was going to break it, cheap plastic construction. it was so not what I expected, returned it the day after I received it.

Reviews.Title: Not What I Thought I Was Buying
Reviews.Author: Paul Wasserman
Reviews.Content: I studied all of the point and shhot cameras and mistakenly chose this Canon. It was light as a feather and the quality of fotos were not up to quality and previous reviews, if actually from buyers, had much different opinions than I. I purchased this as a gift to retunr to Brazil with and was embarassed to give it, so know I must buy another camera. My first erroneous purchase with Amazon.
